text: UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 Bottle at hoppy loft. Yegllow colour small white lacing. Nose is medium stro acetic notes, light lactic acid. Taste is low bitterness. Acetic acid, light horseblanket, strog animal sour notes. Low carbonation. Strong, unripen grapfruit notes. Nice geuze but expected more from my first cantillion.

Pite na miejscu, w browarze. Aromat skórzany kojarzący się trochę z potem, lekko owocowy, białe winogrona, agrest. W smaku lekka kwaśność, cierpkość, na koniec wytrawne. Wszystkie komponenty od aromatu po fajny balans w ustach dają bardzo dobrze pijalne piwo.

375 ml bottle. Pours a clear golden with an off-white, quickly disappearing head. The aroma is medium yeasty, leather, cheese, sour apples, lightly musty. Light to medium body with a medium carbonation, a medium sourness and a light bitterness. The flavor is full of fruity acidity, lemon, kiwi, unripe plums followed by tart berries and some cellary impressions, light peppery in the finish. Rather complex taste. Ends with a dry astringent finish.
Pours a clear golden body with almost no head. Funky aroma with a sour feel. Taste is well balanced sour with a nice fruityness.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Bit acetonic, hay, barnyard, esters. Appearance: No head, golden clear body. Taste: Medium sourness, barnyard, some fruit, some acetone, tannins, very harsh on the finish. Palate: Medium body, low carbonation.

Pomarańczowe, mętne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana biała, drobna, obfita, zostaje na tafli, lacingu brak. W aromacie stajnia, trochę jabłek, agrestu, trochę kwiatowo. W smaku bardzo intensywne cytrusy, agrest, jabłko, taniny, dzikusy. Wysycenie niskie, goryczka niska, posmak dziki, cytrusowy.

Had both tap and bottles of different vintages. I prefer bottles. Aroma has horse blanket, funky, acidic, lemon. Flavour is heavenly, with funky notes, acidic dryness, moderate sour, lovely roasted barley taste. Aftertaste is so crisp, tart and sour. Amazing.
On tap at Akkurat. Taste of fresh juicy green apples, yeast and lemon zest. Hay and white bread.

Aroma: green apple, sour, barnyard.
Appearance: light amber without head.
Taste: sour moving to sweetness, green apple, fruits, light nice bitterness in the finish.
Palate: light body, light carbonation, dry finish.
DWF lys uklart med hvit flott skum som varer. Aroma syrlig bakterier. Smak bitter syrlig
Bottle at Bois Cereste in Akasaka. Cloudy orange-yellow. Wonderful aroma of spice, floral, strawberry, lemon. Sour apple punch. Finish is mineraly and malty. Sticky texture. Medium-full body.

375ml bottle. A gorgeous looking beer, clear amber-gold, creamy off-white foam head, bubbles shooting up. Moderate aroma, barnyard hay, lemon, freshly cut flowers, a little lactic acid. Crisp sour taste, citrus, white wine grape, yoghurt. Funky notes and cloudiness in the last 50ml pour. Nice fizz up front, sour and tart notes spread over the palate, medium body, ends bone dry. Lovely balance.

375ml bottle obtained in a trade. Pours golden copper. Slight haze with a thick, frothy off white head. Long lasting leaving thick lacing. Fully carbonated. Smells oaky, distinct lambic funk profile, fruity, some lemon zest and citrus aroma. Smooth, lemony, citrus lambic funk with a slight bitter, dry finish. Very tasty with a great oak backbone. Nice smooth, crisp mouthfeel. Full aftertaste with a perfect carbonation. Just what I was looking for in this bottle. Nothing crazy but perfect the way it is.

750ml bottle. As 100% Lambic Bio. (5.5% ABV) Pours a hazy orange with a medium, short lived, fizzy, white head that leaves spotty lacing. Aroma of barnyard, leather, lemon, green apple, apricot, orange and vinegar. Sweet fruity flavour of lemon, grapefruit, lime, orange, apricot, green apple, vinegar and light brett with a dry, tart, bitter, champagne-like finish. Light to medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Very nice, has some complexity.

Żółciutkie, klarowne, piana szybko opada. W aromacie jest dosyć mało brettów. w smaku głównie kwasność i taniniczność, mało skóry. jak na gueuze, to jest bardzo gładko i grzecznie. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.
Stajnia, agrest, biała porzeczka, trochę kwaśnych jabłek, w smaku świetnie zbalansowane, nisko-średnia kwaśność.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa, Rome-Italy. Orange bright and a bit hazy color, white foam with medium retention. Nose: yellow fruit, soft and smooth lemon skin, sour hints. Elegant aroma. Mouth: refreshing, smooth grapefruit, much grapefruit and tons of fruit.

Zapach umiarkowanie kwaśny, dziki, skóra, cytryna, kwaśne jabłko, kolendra, zioła i kwiaty, dosyć mineralny. W smaku dosyć jest kwaśne, bardziej dzikie, orzeźwiające z zaznaczoną średnią w stronę delikatnej, goryczką. Słodycz kojarząca się z węgierskim Tokajem, garść cytryn, niuansy kwiatowe, funky.
Pours clear golden with no head. Spiky, sour citrus aroma. Flavour is dominated by tart sourness... light funk, green apple... dry finish. Not really a style I enjoy, but this was very nice.
On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Bruxelles. Pours golden with short lasting small white head. Fruity, citrus, sour, barnyard, acidic. Light to medium bodied. Dry finish.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a lasting sudsy off white head. Aroma is of citrus, melon, pear, funky. Taste is of citrus, lemongrass, melon, green apple, acidic, funky. Oily mouthfeel, dry finish, medium carbonation.

Tappad 2011
Bärigt syrlig doft med inslag av stall, aning urin, citrus och tropiska frukter.
Gyllengul färg, halvdisig. Ett champagneskum som lägger sig omedelbart.
Avrundad, syrlig och stor, mogen karaktär. Lite mjölksyra men med härlig vinägarartad riktning utan att bli tvär eller kantig. Torr avslutning. Hatten av för en super-gueuze och utmärkt hantverk!

Bottle 0.75l: pours hazy orange oeel like golden with beige/off-white tan head with good lacing. Aroma: hay, leather, grapes, lemongrass, funk...flavor: white bread, hay, leather, funk, lemongras, lime, hint of sweet grapes, dry, tart finish. Light to moderate body, soft texture, moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 375mL bottle. Bottled 9/2015. Pours gold with a small white head. Aroma is hay, earth, yeast, and funk. Taste is dry and tart with earth, straw, spice, pepper, white grapes, and wood. Somewhat sweet. Medium body. Moderate carbonation.
Pale, hazy with no head. Nice sour and funky aroma, slightly acetic acid. Beer is really sour, refreshing and complex. Average carbonation.
Darker golden pour, smaller head. Barnyard, earth, funk, yeast, lemon in the aroma. Funky up front, citrus notes, earthy, barnyard, horseblanket, light wood. Medium to lighter body.
Bottle at Herman - hazy golden color with small creamy head. Taste is slightly sour, spicy, white bread, barnyard. Medium malty body. Okay, but not super-duper to me...

Bottle. Hazy pale gold colour. Earthy, yeasty barnyard aroma and taste. Earth, leather, wood. Funky & musty. Sour, quite astringent, dry. Grapefruit citrus-fruity, lemony. Tart green apples. Spritzy. Long very dry, dry finish. (2008)
Unripe lemon and smooth brett horse leather velvet, sweet frozen lemon + plastelin funk, med fresh oranges lactic sour, light tannins; gentle

Hazy light bronze, robust ever-lasting finely bubbled head that glaciates its way down the glass. The retention on this beer was remarkable. Aroma is awesome and ever-changing throughout the drinking experience. Initially lots of basement must and cobwebs, followed variously by notes of light vinegar, petroleum, white grape juice, horseblanket, and dried out corn stalks in autumn. Flavours are complex as expected, but are centered around a surprisingly toasty malt base (not expected). Lots of funky horseblanket, light pear and green grape fruit, some yoghurty lactic acidity, light vinegar, light acetone. Finish is mildly sour and astringent. I was anticipating this with high expectations, and I was not disappointed. Absolutely fantastic
very sharp taste. strongly sour and a bit acidic. its not my beer style, but quality is here.

Citric, lactic, peppery, funky, fruity, pale, hazy, definitely sour but pleasant and tremendously refreshing, light bitterness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, very long lasting astringent nice finish. Its hard to describe a beer like that, just try it and enjoy. I found it in keg and I had two glasses because one wasnt enough to get me satisfied.
Had on tap in NaparBCN, in Barcelona. Absolute classic. Sour, earthy, lihgt color, light flavor. Sour.

Zapach intensywny, kwaśny, cytrusy, zboże, końska derka. Kolor złoty, mętne. Piana niska, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku wytrawne, średnia kwaśność, średnia pełnia, cytryny, winogrona, drewno, zboże, stajnia, końska derka. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.
W aromacie stajnia, skóra, dzikość, bretty, nuty drewna. W smaku mega orzeźwiające, kwaśne, lekko cierpkie w posmaku. Świetne piwo!

Bottle (750ml) at 6 degrees North Edinburgh
AROMA: bread, barnyard, dough, 
APPEARANCE: pale, hazy, white foam, minimal head, 
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, 
PALATE: 
medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent, long finish, 
OVERALL: very nice Geuze; barnyard aroma works with medium sourness. Not to repeat as reeks havoc on the system.

butelka/strefa piwa. złote z obfitą drobnopęcherzykową, białą pianą, utrzymująca się do końca picia. aromat stajni, obory, mokrego siana, wyczuwalane również nuty ziołowo-cytrusowe, no i jest też funky, wszystko w miarę na podobnym poziomie, bez dominacji żadnej ze składowych. w smaku umiarkowanie kwaśne, przechodzące w wytrawność z ziołowo-łodygowym finiszem. ciekawe, duża przyjemność z picia. jeżeli dobrze pamiętam to w maju 2016 butelkowane
Zeer helder uitziende gueuze. Aroma is citrus en hout. Smaak is in eerste instantie zeer clean en vlak maar barst dan mooi open. Citrus, houterige bitter, hints van citrus. Droge finish. Top.

Bottle. Cloudy golden with tinny white head. Medium and very pleasant aromas of barnyard, wood, bretts and some citrus notes. Light to medium body, right carbonated, very refreshing, little bit salty with good sour finish. Really enjoyed.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 26 Jan 2017: 2007 vintage sampled at the brewery. Very complex notes on this 10 year old vintage, much softer, despite the higher carbonation, fruitier and rounder. Nice!

75cl bottle, at home. Semi-hazy orange pour with a thin white head with poor retention and visible carbonation rising to the top. Notes of lambic funk, barnyard, hay, apple cider, macerated apples, pears, light vinegar, baking soda, white grapes, some hop-like bitterness. Medium bitter and medium sour. A really refreshing gueuze. 4/5

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Złociste, lekko zamglone. Drobna biała piana dość szybko redukuje się do krążka. Bogaty aromat zmieniający się wraz z ogrzaniem. Jest dzikość, czuć bretty, drewno staje się bardzo wyraźne. Do tego lekki słód i kwaśność. W smaku wytrawnie. Jest kwaśność, trochę cytrusowa. Na finiszu lekka pestkowa cierpkość. Bardzo fajne, złożone ale przy tym lekkie piwo.

Aroma: Heavy earthy funk, wet oak, damp dusty basement, cardboard & cheese as it warms. Taste: Firm sourness, it has that damp earthy funk again in the the flavour and also has a heavy mineral character to it. Overall: Very complex gueuze, Ive had bottles of this before but cant remember them having such an earthy damp funk forward aroma and flavour to them.
Great wild aroma, a lot of horse and other brett aromas. Moderate sourness. Great taste, citric, brett, less sour than I expected, but a lot of great lambic notes.

750ml bottle from sklepzpiwem.pl Gdańsm. 2015 vintage 
Aroma of horse sweat and hay. Some white fruit and citrus fruit aromas. Surprisingly practically no vinegar. 
Taste is citric and a bit bitter, rather dry and sour. 
Very drinkable yet I was expecting more complexity

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wood, citrus.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts slightly/medium swert with malts and wood; ends slightly dry and sour with citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather complex and balanced, but lacks intensity. Even for its abv, the beer is really mellow and fails to create a lasting impression. Would almost say it is too easy to drink and could have been much more extreme.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Chciałbym mieć w lodówce niekończący się zapas tego cuda. Niesamowita klasa.
Sour, lactic notes, fruits, golden with a thin white head, medium body, fizzy, brett, lactic...a great gueze.

375 ml Bottle from share. Cloudy pale golden with soft bubbly head. Sour notes from the get-go, brett, mild fruity aromas. Taste follows with more of the brett, soft tartness, some barrel notes, Light and airy. And delicious

F: big, white, not long lasting.
C: orange gold, hazy.
A: barnyard, brettanomyces, woody, basement, light fruity, citrus.
T: citrus, funky, barnyard, brett, woody, fruity, basement, medium body, good carbonation, perfect lambic harmony, poured glass @ Cantillon in Brussels.
Bottle. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma is tart, full of grapes, oranges, light woody, funky. Tart taste, grapes, lemon, vinous notes, barnyard, wood, funky notes. Gooood

Colore rosso arancio. Lassemblaggio di lambic giovani e lambic mature le donano un profumo di uva ed un gusto acidulo, fruttato ed allo stesso tempo secco e ripulente, che la rende idonea ad essere gustata sia come aperitivo che come birra di chiusura in una serata di degustazione.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Incredibly balanced in spite of its spiky sourness and acidity. Very tasteful and citrussy. One of the best geuezes ive ever had. It is very clean and has that maple syrup colour and very little carbonation.
Nice sour tart and fruit. Cloudy dark yellow. Palate sticks to tongue and cheeks. Bottle

Worlds classic indeed. Nice orange body with some white head. Medium carbonated, nice lambic aroma, reminds me a bit of winey and champagney marks. Well balanced and all, not easy to criticize, but I had way more exciting lambic exeriences.

Copper, opaque weak head.
Smell is sour wood, leather sour apples, hint of vanilla,cumin, coriander, minerals. Beautiful!
Taste is sour sour sour! Hint of bitterness and bare suggestion of fruity sweetness. For the rest lots of wood and refreshing fizziness. Some puke, yoghurt. Salty with a mouth-watering finish.
1 year old bottle bio. Very nice complete taste. One of the best lambic bears Ive tasted. My favorite is the dry sourness at the ending.
Tap @ Brussels Moeder Lambic Font / Clear gold color. No head. Nose is apples and blue cheese, bactine spray*. Light mouthfeel dry astringent finish.

Barwa złocista, zamglona. Piana obfita, całkiem ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat kwaśny, są niedojrzałe owoce, jakieś winogrona, cytryna, do tego lekka stajnia. W smaku jest średnio kwaśne, owocowe, bardzo pijalne i orzeźwiające. Wysycenie jest średnie, goryczka lekka, w ustach zostają długie posmaki.
Zwanze day 2016. Very similar to Limbic but carbonated and more pronounced flavours.

Pours clear golden orange with a small white ring. Smells sour and slightly sweet. Taste is sour. Light-bodied with a sharp texture and average mouth-carbonation, Cantillon Gueuze Lambic 100% Bio finishes with a lingering subtle sourness.

Ma première "vraie" gueuze mais certainement pas la dernière... Je comprends maintenant pourquoi on se larrache. Cette bière na aucun défaut. Cest si complexe et délicat à la fois, tout en ayant beaucoup de corps. Au visuel, elle est plutôt dorée. Le parfum et le goût sont plutôt boisés et citronnés. Ça maide à mieux situer le savoir-faire des artisans brasseurs dici où je vis (qui sont excellents) ;-) Ma bouteille est datée de 2015.

A: Cloudy light orange with a thin white head. 
N: Lemon
T: Lemon again, with the faintest dank horse blanket note
F: Light astringency
O: Not aggressive, with all the lambic elements in perfect harmony,.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Almost fruity funk and stables. Well balanced sourness and tartness, with a soft but lively carbonation. Medium body, made refreshing by the sourness and carbonation. Very drinkable. Classic in taste, setting a standard to live up to.

Draft in a tumbler at Sovereign on Zwanze Day 2016 courtesy of Huhzubendah (previously had a couple bottles at Sovereign during visits earlier in the year). Clear viscous copper-gold with faint white head. Funky and acidic, with citrus, yeast, and grains. Very drinkable, though with many Cantillons (for me) the acid starts building up after several glasses. Awesome gueuze.
Klar gylden bru med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter sure lukter som sitron, lime og noe mot champagne. River litt i nesa. Smaker surt, eddik, sitron, vanilje, epler og trevirke. Middels lang.

Tap into a pint glass showing dark orange with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of acetic and balsamic vinegar. 

The palate is full bodied and fully carbonated. Flavors of lightly tart orange and zest with a very light zesty white wine bitterness.

Bottle from Cantillon enjoyed in San Diego California. Clear golden copper color. Epic sauerkraut and pickels and white wine plus vinegar aroma. Taste mirrors the aroma plus epic sour dry flavor ending in super dry unripe wallnut taste. Nyebutchcoo epic!

375 mL bottle. Bottled 12/30/2009. Originally reviewed 9/10/2012.

Hazy yellow-orange with a nice pillow of foam. Doesnt yield an impressive head, but sticks around long enough to compensate.

Nose is citrus acidity. Orange is the best descriptor. Grainy wheat with just a touch of funk in the aroma. Straightforward, but maybe lacking in some complexity.

Tastes of sour-forward citric flavors. Orangy and lemony. Oaky and a little bit of a white wine flavor. Definitely lacking in the complexity of some of the great gueuzes, but what it provides is exemplary.

Sweeter than other gueuzes. Not as dry. Very tart, but too much sugar to be spritzy.
Id take Drie Fonteinen any day over this. Not many other things Id take over it, though. To complain about it is splitting hairs.

Unclear, yellow-golden colored, small non lasting white head. Aroma is of some malt and grapes, barnyard funk, some lemony and spicy notes. Taste is light+ sweet malt, spicy lemony, moderate barnyard funk and sourness, dry but not over the top. Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Not my style usually but this one was pretty fine.
(bottle)

Clear golden color with white head. Aroma has really nice cellar funk, dank wood, barnyard and hay. Taste starts sour but not really acidic. I also get lemon and unripe stonefruits with some farmhouse funk on the finish. Dry body with medium effervescence. Really well made gueuze, one of my all time favorites.

Piana nieduża, sycząca, szybko opada do zera. Barwa złota, delikatnie opalizująca. Aromat kwaskowy, głównie niedojrzałe jasne winogrona, agrest, cytryna, skóra, końska derka, wilgotna piwnica, lekka kuweta. W smaku średnio kwaśne, cytrynowo winogronowe, mineralne, wręcz lekko słonawe, cierpkie, konkretnie dzikie w posmakach. Wysycenie średnie, rześkie.
Bardzo udane Gueuze, którego największą zaletą jest smak (przy nieco mniej porywającym aromacie) - kwaśność na średnim poziomie, całkiem wyraźne bretty, bardzo pijalne i idealne na pragnienie.

Aroma is sour lemon with hay and a energetic fruityness from unripe green apples. Taste is fruity acidity with slight grassy sidenotes. Green apples and stable notes ends up in a tart and dry finish. This legendary Gueuze brings it!
05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. 1996 vintage!! Just wow. This beer develops such an amazing comlexity after 20 years. Dry heavy sourness.

Piwo to ma bardzo ładny jasny kolor, jest lekko mętne. Jego zapach jest zdecydowanie winny. Posiada słabą białą piane. Piwo jest bardzo wytrawne i kwaśne, ale przyjemne. Wyczułem też lekką goryczke. Piwo w przeszło lekko smakiem korka, ale nie przeszkadzało mi to, jest ono bardzo orzeźwiające

Pours cloudy with a lovely head. Wow this is good! Wonderfully complex. So much better then the relatively simple Boon Oude Gueuze. Sharp, tangy with some straw and lively fermentation. Some sourness with a fruity sweetness tip. Oh I do like this I need to try more Gueze as I have painfully little to judge it against.

Aromat intensywny. Kwaskowy, dziki. Jet cierpki. Aż drażniący. 
Jest lekka nuta kwaśnych jabłek. Potem nuta wytrawnych brzoskwiń.
Potem pod nim wychodzi lekka słodowość. 
W smaku bardzo kwaśne. Cierpkawy w drugiej nucie, potem to mija. Zostaje bardzo przyjemny kwaskowy posmak. 
Przypomina bardzo kwaśnego, wytrawnego szampana.

In der Nase ein kräftiger modriger Gärgeruch. Hört sich unangenehm an, passt aber gut zum Bier. Toll. Der Trunk schön wallend und leider etwas eindimensional sauer. Macht aber nichts, der Nachhall kommt schnell und ist gegen den Strom. Klar säuerlich gehört dazu, zusätzlich ist er aber auch gutmütig samtig. Was für ein Ausklang. 375ml Flasche direkt von der CANTILLON Brauerei. Ca.5-7 Euro???

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma has light malt, but foremost brett, straw, horse stable, some sourness and citrus notes. Taste is fruity with citrus, brett, light malt, straw and semi-sour and pretty dry. Easy drinking and refreshing.

Bottle shared with Simonsen at Hvaler
Golden, clear, thin white head. Smell of funk, silo, berries, barnyard, mold, wheat abd light malts. A very complex brett aroma. Light sweet, tart, medium to heavy sour, berries, complex brett and farm flavors, woody and oaky flavors after a while. Very good stuff

2013 375ml bottle. All kinds of funk -- barnyard, cave, leather -- but light and dry, with essentially no sourness and a little bit of apple juice flavor at the end. Balanced, dry, but not quite as interesting as I was expecting. Still, this deserves its worldwide reputation.

Bottle from Craft Bar in Grayton Beach, Florida. Pours deep gold with small white head that dissipates. Aroma smells of citrus funk, danky sour cave. Taste is tart lemon peel, funky, sharp, dank wood, medium to high carbonation. Medium body. Lengthy finish as the palate recovers from each sip. So good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma has lots of sour rasin and pine. Taste is sour with bitter aftertaste. Medium body

Aroma is spicy and earthy on top of all the funkiness and acetiness, but somewhat lacking depth. Lovely taste and palate: bone dry, not much sourness, phenolic/grapefruity bitterness gives it an extremely crispy finish. Amazing!

5%ABV. Gueuze.

Poured out dark gold. 10ºSRM.

Nose is acetic and lemon juice.

Mouthfeel is soda. Palate has some good malt base, but there is not much appreciable malt character left. Palate has wood, white white, pale grape, green plums, Chinese lemon preserves, A little alcohol on the back of the throat.

Finish is dry, champagne like and Woody.

Goes on Favorites List !
The time and effort they put into this beer is what makes it the #1 beer and brewey in the world.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, march 18th 2016. Orange body with a white head. Aroma of barnyard, earth, leather, wood. Taste is sour, adds grapes and peel, quite funky, with a fresh fruity and flowery sourness. Lasting acidity, dry and nice.
375ml bottle (thx JameyW!). Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sour, funky, winey, some champagne notes, earthy. Taste is tart, winey, woody, earthy. Dry, tart aftertaste. Good.
Flaska från Brugge. Orangefärgade med lättsam vit skumkrona. Doft av vitt vin och vitvinsvinäger. Syrlig, rå kropp. Smak av vitvinsvinäger, krusbär, lime och vitt vin. Ren och härlig smak.
Flaska från Tychojames. Dimmigt orangefärgad med vitt skum. Syrlig doft av äpplekart. Torr munkänsla, väldigt torr och syrlig.

Sample at En Öl- och Whiskymässa, 2016. Hazy yellowish with a small white head, some lacings. Aroma is citrus, tart vinegar, blue cheese, funk, green apples, jam. Taste is medium to highly tart, astringent, green apples, vinegar, slight herbs. Medium body, low carbo, rough and bold.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 2015 bottle Clear gold color. No head. Nose is apples and blue cheese, bactine spray*. Light mouthfeel dry astringent finish.

Flaska rose red cafe.
Grumlig gyllengul kulör. Mycket stallig bonnig doft. Funkig med vinäger och citron. 
Följer med in i smaken. Torr och syrlig med träig smak. Örter och halm. Lite avslagen munkänsla

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 APPEARANCE: golden colour with a medium white head.AROMA: funky, medium sour, with hints of apple and citrus fruits.TASTE: reflects the aroma. PALATE: light bodied; lively carbonation; and low bitterness.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2016 Pours a red colour, with a pinky small head that fades  leaving a creamy lace. Aroma of grapefruits, apple, citrus, cider, cherry, wood, vanilla.. Creamy and  sour palate, normal carbonation. Taste of cherries; apples, grapefruits, wood, vanilla..
Tap at Logans. Golden with one finger head. Cant say Ive had anything quite like this. Lemony vinegar funk. Light white grape. Very good, but I had crazy expectations for this.
Bottle @ home. Aroma of brett, citrus and light malty. Clear yellow amber with white head, not lasting. Taste is moderate sour and light bitter. Light+ body, dry feel, sour finish.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Remembered as more impressive. This time it was raw but subdued. Little carbonification, (un)noticeable from pulling out the cork. Taste like faded citrus fruit and peel, a little funk that lingers in the after taste with a bitter sensation. Bottled 23.11.15. Lot: DN Temp 5C. Bought at brewery.

Cerveza lambica que me sorprendió muy gratamente por su buen paso en boca, suave y sabroso sin el punto ácido que suelen tener las cervezas de fermentación expontanea. Puedo repetir de esta cerveza sin problemas por el sabor tan bueno que tiene, que no carga.
Aroma: funky, sour fruits and lemon. Taste: dry, lemon, funky, pleasant sourness, little bit of grapes; very drinkable and refreshing. Medium head, average lacing and low to medium carbonation.
Light golden color, white lacing. Muted aroma of funk, lemon, and musk. Taste is more bitter than tart or funky. Light body, moderate carb, and a rather abrupt finish.

Fint pissgult och underbart! Grumlig, benvitt huve! Naturliga bubblor! Doft av gröna äpplen, hö, vinäger, citrus & nystädad allmän toalett!
Riktigt bra syra i smaken, doften går igenom i smaken & men lämnar eftersom sig en liten bitterhet från en äpplestjärna :D 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smashing. Smells like aging Roquefort in a cave with dripping ceilings. Dank funky awesome. The intensity of the long finish lingers
Draft - White grape and nice funk. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Funky, some grape and citrus with a peel. Not nearly as acidic

Non ho ancora assaggiato le altre produzioni di Cantillon. Non male come gueuze, cè qualcosa che non mi ha convinto nel sapore, ma non so esprimerlo bene a parole. 3 fonteinen finora rimane la migliore per me, nonostante la fama leggendaria di questo birrificio.
Bottle in Amboise France. Hazy gold with thin white head, well carbonated. Aroma is tart Apple, pear and white wine. Flavor is tart sour funky and delicious... I believe I'll have another!!!

2014 100% Lambic Bio. Half the bottle drunk at home, the other half went in to a Beef Carbonnade. 30/05/16. Bought at Bitter Virtue, Southampton. That sour apple-like aroma hits you as soon as you take a sniff. Hazy but pale with a very lively head. Sour but not overly so - there is still a hint of sweetness and I didnt have to pull a face like a cats arse. Im not sure that much more can be added. You either like a sour beer or you dont. I do but not more than one at a time.
Big sour smells. Pours orange gold with a white head rapidly dissipating. Sour round apricots lemons and cooked carrots. Oily light carbonation with big flavors and a lingering finish. Wow.
W aromacie winne, stajenne, owocowe. Złożony, intensywny aromat. Barwa rubinowa, obfita piana. W smaku kwaśne, wytrawne, winne, wiśniowe. Orzeźwiające, z niską goryczką, wysokonasycone. Bardzo dobre!
Esto es un cervezón, como su madre lambic pero con más gas, espuma y presencia. Uma obra maestra.

Bottle from the brewery; and my last beer in Belgium. Unclear orange. Faint white head. A bit of funk, more so in the aroma. Medium tart. Citric. Lemon. Grape. Medium dryness. Nothing harsh. Just enough carbonation om the tounge. Refreshing, easy to drink, balamced and interesting. I wish I could have such cheap easy access to it as I do right now.
A pleasant light orange/citrus tartness and tanginess. Still fairly refreshing with the tartness. delicious.

Bottle bough at Rudat in Dortmund bottled 2015.09.01, poured into nosing glass. Clear orange color with low head. Nose is slightly acidic, Apple and grapes. Taste is mild acidic Brut cidre like Apple taste. Astringent dry finish with acidic hints... Best it gets for me...

Bottled in april 2014.
Aroma: earthy, leather, stable, wooden, wine vinegar, orange skin and white grapes.
Appearance: orange color, cloudy liquid, white, quickly dissapearing foam.
Taste: light sweetness, medium sourness turning little bitter at the end of bottle.
Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture, long finish.
Overall: its worth reputation of one of the best standard edition of gueze beers. Even my female flatmates liked it!
At Cantillon brewery. White wine, sour apple, tart white grape, a slight lemony taste. Juicy sour finish. Tasty.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Sourness hits hard, but gently. Fine hints of fruits like apple. Flowerish. Usual sour wine like boogie. Basic gueuze. Well balanced. Slightly sharp.

13/05/2016 - glass from 37,5 cl bottle @ the brewery, Brussels.
Yellow/orange with a nice white head. Nose is light sour, bit grains, hints of green apple and citrus. Taste is more grains, not as sour as expected but very enjoyable and tempting enough however. Very nice basic gueuze.

Egzemplarz po 2,5 letnim leżakowaniu, Z wyglądu pomarańczowa, zawiesista ciecz z nikłą pianą, dość wysycona. Aromat to pszenica, banany, drożdże, nieco wina musującego, czuć też taką rześką kwiatowość. W smaku mocna kwaskowatość od pszenicy, po niej uderza lekka winogronowa słodycz i delikatny drożdżowy posmak. Świetne do gaszenia pragnienia, ale też bogate w smaku i aromacie, wymaga nieco skupienia do wyciągnięcia różnych posmaków. Charakter po części kwasu, po części szampana, wytrawne, przyjemne

Smell: Barnyard, basement, sour.
Taste: first: sour, tart; mids: fruity notes, basement; after: citrus
Dominant: Acidic, tart, citrus.
Pours a hazy golden color with a good amount of head and lacing. Musty smell and tastes of lemons and wood. Excellent beer.

From the decanter into the glass, at the Cantillon Brewery: Slightly hazy golden colored brew with more foamy head than the Jonge Lambiek. Taste is dry and also sour but slightly more gently. Hints of lemon and ripe apples.

Cantillons brews are... Well, whats to say about them that hasnt already been said? My tasting of this was with one of the newer vintages: Classic Geuze. Gold color with lively, fizzy head. Aroma of horse blanket, barnyard, dirty diaper, and citrus. Flavors are funky, lemony, tart, cheesy, and acidic. Mouthfeel certainly is sour but its not harsh - only a bit of vinegar-style acid. All told, this is a lovely Geuze. One of those brews that you could drink for days and still find something new to talk about.

Butelka 0,375l spożyte w domu. Kolor złoty z przebarwieniami orange, piana drobnoziarnista pięknie oblepia. Aromat gruszek i jabłek z piwnicy. Smak trochę zbyt kwaśny, winogrona, białe owoce. Trochę winne wykończenie. W szkle prezentuje się świetnie jak szampan

UPDATED: APR 22, 2016 375ml bottle from private import. Aroma: great dusty lemon, ripped apples. App: hazy golden with small white head, little lacing. Taste and palate: thin body, light to moderate carbonation, lemony, fruity, woody, moderate extra dry acidity astringent finish. Overall: good but finish is a bit weird, something not that pleasant. So dry. Only felt it when too cold. I like the aroma and taste though. Probably needs some aging. Will review again in a few years. Pretty sure it will get more points.

A slightly hazy golden color with minimal white head. Smell is a stinky cheese, vinegar, juicy fruit, sour candy, sawdust. Taste is a medium sourness up front followed by old cheesy hops, a bit plastic, some apricot and pear, vinegar. Champagne like dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy amber with very little white head and minimal lacing. Aroma is tart smelling with wood and light fruit. Taste is tart with wood, funk and light fruit.

A slightly hazy golden color with minimal white head. Smell is a stinky cheese, vinegar, juicy fruit, sour candy, sawdust. Taste is a medium sourness up front followed by old cheesy hops, a bit plastic, a slight chemical, some light fruit notes, vinegar. Champagne like dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cantillon Geuze 5% 

A beautiful looking brassy orange with a great aroma of tart earthy funk and pronounced grape+plum notes. Its a 2015 vintage so a bit young but smells great. 

Lovely soft body that delivers a fairly full mouthfeel. The taste is a touch acidic, some funk, lactic acid giving tart lemon or lime and some oak in the finish. Great stuff.
Tasted at Cantillon Brewery/Museum,. Light hazy yellow with no head. Aroma is lemon, barnyard and horse blanket. Aroma is sour with notes of lemon

Almost no head, clear golden orange. Super dry citrus berry nose. Super funky, earthy. Sour, some bitterness. Medium body, effervescent. Very acidic. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep golden under a thin white foamy cap. Amazing earthy sour aroma with earthy fruity funk, barrels, a bit of lacto, and white grape. Amazing flavor full of lacto wild yeast tones, a touch of sour acidity, earthy funky fruit, a touch of dust, and finishes a little peachy and appley. Really amazing geuze, tart, earthy funky, fruity, and very very unique and impeccable.

375ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with a thin white head. Aroma is acidic with lemon and vinegar, yeast, funky and rustic notes. Taste is similar, acidity is excellent and not too strong at all, citrus flavors, yeast again, light final bitter note. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Draft 0.25l at In De Wildeman Amsterdam Netherlands.29.03.2016.Taste with adamnowek.Finally to rate this tried it so many times in my life.Taste as 100% Lambic.Pour it hazy orange/golden color with no head.Aroma salty,quite peppery,really pleasent.Taste funky sourish not so agressive,tingling in your throat,lemony,citrus on the back,finish harsh lemon zest feel.Perfext balanced and great complexity.
My 900th rating. Bottle from Bradleys. Cloudy gold with little head. Sour aroma of grapes with some wood. Nice and tart. Refreshing with a hint of oak. Need to find me an aged bottle next time.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Flaske. Lett disig gylden farge. Moderat karbonert. Lett skum. Smaker eddik/melkesyre,sitrus,syrlig frukt,stikkelsbær,druestein.Behagelig sur. Meget bra

Wow whatever year this is, its a great one. On tap at Torst 3rd birthday. Pours a cloudy golden yellow orange. Not really much of a head. Aromas of minerals, slight rubber, light funk, sour aromas, wet hay. Taste is medium acidity. More minerals. Medium body. Just freaking awesome.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, Gus, and others. Aroma is sweet sour, funk, skins, barnyard. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is funk, slight sour, somewhat medicinal, weird permanent marker. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, permanent market aftertaste. Overall, for my first Cantillon, this is disappointing.

Typowo dzikie aromaty z uzupełnieniem owocowym, jabłko z cytryna
W smaku delikatne rześkie, mało ciała troche kwaśny owocowy i stajenny posmak, orzeźwiajacy
Podsumowując dobre
Bottle. Clean, complex sour focusing on the citrus fruits. Grapefruit, lemon. Quite tart to begin, settling with some rind-y bitterness at the back of the palate.

Pomarańczowo-złoty kolor z niską białą pianą. W aromacie nuty kwaśne, dzikie, delikatne cytrusy i zielone jabłko. W smaku w zasadzie podobnie plus nuty drewna. Gładkie i świetnie zbalansowane. Nuty kwaśne umiarkowane.
Świetny Lambic!

ASPETTO: oro antico, limpido. Schiuma bianca, fine e quasi per nulla persistente. AROMA: complesso e intenso. Chiare note citriche e acide. Sentori di cuoio e un po di putridume che in una Gueuze ci sta sempre bene. Leggero tocco floreale, più che altro però sommerso dagli altri sentori. GUSTO: acida, ma neanche troppo. Chiarissimo limone, che stimola molto la salivazione e lascia un sapore fresco e dissetante in bocca. Si avverte anche il cuoio e il putrido. Birra decisamente particolare, non sono un appassionato dello stile, ma questa mi è piaciuta. Se non altro, come qualsiasi lambic, è unesperienza particolare.

November, 2013, classic gueuze. As it warmed up, the sour became more pronounced. Very tart, full mouthfeel, straw color. 
First time drinking a Cantillon. Enjoyed it very much.
at the brewery: golden, white head, unclear, barnyard and fruit smell, some sweetness, fades into bitter and sour funky taste, citric fruit, lively carbonation, oily mouthfeel,
Deze geuze is te vergelijken met champagne. Zeer fris, krachtig van smaak en met een mooie balans tussen zuur, zoet en een klein beetje bitter. Eikenhout komt mooi uit in aroma en smaakpalet.
Tasted in brewery tasting room. Awesome, super dry aroma, harsh and annoying wooden notes in the taste. Its just beautiful.

2008 Vintage: Consumed in JAN:2016.

Note: Bottle bought and consumed at Moeder Lambic. Stored in proper cellar conditions.

AROMA: More pronounced and refined than a fresh bottle. Maybe a hint more parmesan cheese and tropical fruit. Green apples also seemed to some through in smell and taste.

APPEARANCE: Deeper in colour less head retention. Oily, less lively.Possibly more lacing on the glass than the usual recent vintages.

TASTE: Oakier, Creamier, funkier, oilier, more balanced and refined. Green apples and tropical fruit. Noticed a slightly peppery note you might associate with Saisons, perhaps this is a by product of Brett being given additional time to develop?

PALATE: Less of a quencher and more of a sipper. Long lasting, creamy, thicker, slicker, cloying mouth feel. Just so much more balanced than a current vintage, though also Intense. Carbonation certainly took a back seat however it was still present though due to saturation. I believe it allowed other flavour notes to shine through more and become more or less pronounced.

OVERALL: Its a better beer when aged. Its different though retains the Cantillon stamp. Everything seems more concentrated and surprisingly the oak characters were much more pronounced. I like a fresh Gueuze very much but the 2008 Vintage is proof this is a beer which will refine when stored correctly. I look forward to trying aged Cantillon again.

Bottle 2014. Medium yeasty and light malty aroma. Aroma of citrus, apple and grapefruit. The flavours is heavy sour and light bitter. Finish very dry with lingering sourness. Fizzy carbonation. Champagne Indeed...

Aroma of vinegar, apples, grapes and barnyard.
Very sour, but not too sour. No sweetness or bitterness. Flavor of apples, grapes, lemon. Unfortunately, no barnyard. Resembles dry wine. After it got warmer the sourness stayed on the throat, which (with the lack of barnyard flavor) are the only things I didnt like about this beer.

Aroma - basement, sweat, funk, cork, barnyard, and white flesh fruit
Appearance - the body is goldenrod colored with decent nucleation. The head sets up very nicely; white and about 2 1/2" Very tight and settles slowly.
Taste - sour flavor is prominent. There is an element of white flesh fruit, barnyard, funk, must, horse blanket, even a little cork wood. Some white grape skin as well.
Palate - body is medium body, somewhat vinuous nature, carbonation is lively, the finish dry, fruity, and full of funk.
Incredible for the style. Slightly sour and tart and salty. Pours orange yellow with no head. Had at a beer share at kasers.
My favorite gueuze. The aroma and flavor is very complex and balanced. Must try gueuze for sure.

1/12/16 750ml bottle Old Notes (Label says 5 rd Bottling 2000 (March)-Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of straw, hay, funk, and floral. Taste of the same with some tartness and sourness on the back end. This light bodied brew is different but still quite tasty.

Kolor: złocisty, zamglony.
Piana: średnio obfita, dość trwała.
Zapach: owocowy, winny, szampański, lekko kwiatowy, estrowy, z wyraźnymi aromatami dzikich drożdży.
Smak: wytrawne, wyraźnie garbnikowe, taniniczne, ściągające, są również nuty owocowe, estrowe, kwaśność na średnim poziomie.
Wysycenie: średnie.

Pours a pale golden color with a white head. Funk, sweat, lemon, wood, tart and floral aroma. Lemon, funk, vinegar, grass, floral and cracker flavors. Medium light body and moderate carbonation. Lemon, funk and tart finish.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Tasting at Maakuns, another Maakuns share. Paardenstal, hooi, sexy vaatdoekje, azijn, abrikozenpit. Backlog from 2015/10/09.

Quintessence 2016. Vintage 1996. Hazy golden, thin white head. Very sour, rubbery. More concentrated. Strong minerallike. Very good!

At home, shared bottle with Mrk. Smooth, horse barn, sweat, straw, hay, yeast. Mild sour, mild spiced, light saltiness. Amazing balanced palate. Nice mineral character, deep aromas.
Overall: Stable, vinegar, fruit, rowan berry bitterness. Tart. Delicious.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. (Vintage 2009) Reviewed 2015-12-25.

appearance: light yellow, slightly hazy, excitable bubbly white head.  aroma: sour, lemon, barnyard, sharp funk. taste: sour, sharply funky, with lemon, grapefruit, and grass, with some white pepper.  finish: tart and pretty acidic.  notes: 	Perfect example of the style. First exposure to this brewery. Bottle from Sarah for Beerdvent 2015.

Embouteillée le 01/12/2014, bue après 1 an. Robe dorée claire avec un cerne de mousse. Arômes de citron, levures sauvages, beaucoup de bois, pommes vertes, abricot et melon. En bouche, dominance de lacidité des lambics et transition vers le bois de chêne, citron, abricot et pomme verte. Fin pétillement sur la langue. Goût très sauvage et légère amertume venant du bois. Fiable plutôt brève et bien boisée où les grains maltés semblent vouloir percer. Texture légère et corps mince. Un tantinet trop acide mais reste une excellente gueuze.
Sample @ Cantillon 15/5-15. Fruity and bretty with grapes, also acidic. Dry and acidic finish with grapefruit/peel.
Bottle 2014. Slightly hazy, yellow, no head. Aroma is sour, lemony, barnyard, pepper. In taste medium sour, tart lemon, horse blanket. Light body, high carbonation, dry and tart finish. Nice.
Nice, golden appearance and thin head, which stays. Hay, vinegar, grass, wood, flowers in the aroma. Vinegar, sour white grapes. Apple and oak in aftertaste. Summery and very well balanced lambic.
Ive had this a bunch but first on 3.26.14. A 2013 bottle. This is great. Smell is tart and yeast and mold. Flavor is straight up tart baby diapers. Sold.
From notes on 9/10/15. First beer ordered while at the Cantillon brewery. Very solid gueze. Nice bubbly mouthfeel. Tart and refreshing flavor. Excited to try the rest of there beers.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 2015 Lotto A123 37,5 cl. aperta il 14/12/2015.
Dorata carica, opalescente, schiuma bianca di perlage molto fine, poco persistente.
Aroma di stallatico, lattico, legno umido, frumento, susina acerba, mela verde, leggero citrico che ricorda il pompelmo e le dà un tocco di freschezza, anche durante la bevuta.
Al palato susina acerba, buccia di mela verde, lattico e stallatico, acidula; bella coda con pompelmo: succo e scorza, legno, crosta di pane e frumento, il tutto accompagnato da un tocco acidulo di susina acerba e leggero erbaceo.
Retrolfatto di susina acerba e stallatico.
Corpo medio-leggero, mediamente carbonata, astringente, molto beverina.

------& cl. Imbottigliata il 4 giugno 2015, aperta l8 maggio 2016.
Dorata tendente allarancio, velata dai lieviti, riflessi dorati, schiuma bianca fine ma poco persistente.
Aroma di stallatico, susina acerba, pelle animale, oleosa, pepe, mela verde, leggero frumento, note di legno umido.
Al palato acidula, susina acerba, polvere, pelle animale, pepe, note di mela verde e di legno umido, coda amara erbacea accompagnata da una nota acidula che ricorda la susina acerba e da leggero frumento.
Corpo medio, mediamente carbonata, texture oleosa.

Bottle Thanks to James. Pours a hazy orange, white head. Aroma is heavy oak, musty basement, socks, cheese, apricots, sour fruits. Flavor is oaky musty loveliness, hay, grain, basement funk, cheesy socks. Med body, very solid.
Nog redelijk zoet voor een Geuze, weinig zuurgehalte te bespeuren. Wel bezinksel op de bodem.
Taster from bottle. Pours a hazy pale brown color with little head. Light and easy going. Great balance of mild sourness and the malt.

Deep amber color, no head, strong active effervecence. Complex aroma, barnyard, wood, white wine, spur apple, appricot notes. Flavours of barnyard, wood, sour apple, sour appricot, sweet. Medium sour and dry finish. Great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The quintessential lambic. Perfect balance of sourness. All around great beer. Visit the brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella 37.5 cl tomada en el momento en Cimmeria 20..11..2015. Embotellada 03..06..2014. Color drorado con espuma blanca poco persistente. Aromas y sabores ácidos con toques de maderas secas. Bastante buena en su estilo. Gran acidez. Para repetir.

Poured from a bottle, a hazy golden color. Has that funky barnyard aroma. Lemons, sour apples, salty. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Teatro,Mantova. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma of barnyard, white wine, apples, wood. Sour flavour, apricot, bitter, very dry finish
Bottle, orange with a white head. Light fruity, wood, vinegar, gooseberry, hay, lemon, leather. Somewhat sharp.

Di colore dorato scarico con riflessi arancio, offre una schiuma bianca non imponente, ma vivace, che ne fa intuire la brillantezza al palato. L'aroma è di limone, mela, vino bianco. Al palato la frizzantezza danza con l'acidità e ritornano le note vinose e agrumate. Il finale è da geueze, secco con una percezione di pesca.

Bottle to tulip
Lemon, barnyard funk, apple, and some earthiness. Clear, light amber with active effervescence and a thin white head. Funk, lemon, granny smith apple, a touch of apricot, and bitterness. This is a touch chalky and very dry. This is soooo good.
Lemon fresh and tonic aroma. Poured from 350ml at home. Taste is acidic, lemon and overall good. Hyped up and let me down a little
Non è il mio genere ma questa gueze si beve piacevolmente, ben fatta e acidulità sempre sotto controllo-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle, 2013, thanks rayaron. Clear orange golden with a small white head. Aroma - funky, white wine, apples,vinegar, lemon. Sour flavor, very dry, notes of wood, apples, lemon, white wine, grapefruit. Light-bodied, fun to drink. Great.

Bottle 37.5cl. Bottled on 21 December 2013. Thanks Maakun for the bottle. Clear golden with small white head. Nice aroma of white wine, cider, funk and hint of apricot. Very sour flavor, funk, bitterish with notes of white wine, unripe apricot, apple peels, a bit woody, very dry. Excellent!

Tap @ Akkurat. Mid-Hazy golden, small white head. Oak, hay and alot of green apple and unripe pear mixed with barnyard in the aroma. Very smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Sour taste with fresh lemon, green appels, fruity Brettanomyces, orange, oak and hay.
Bottle from ölbutikken copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden colour beer with a small head. Sour fruity and bretty with notes green apples. Dry sour bretty finish.

A fresh sour, herbal/fruity aroma. Golden clear liquid, medium white head. Well tasting: medium-heavy sour, lightly sweet and bitter. Medium body, average carbonation, quite long lasting sour finish. Cantillon Gueuze is always a great refreshing sour beer!

hazy golden to orange colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of lime, tart, earthy notes, bread and some minimal acetone; taste is dominated by vinegar and lemony sourness with some malty tart notes in the background, wheat, earthy and woody notes can also be felt; great gueuze!

Cheese lemon rind and black pepper citrusy funky yeast. Correct to the style but this gueuze aroma is still growing on me. Very hazy orangey gold. Bite. Tart lemon bitter nice wet and refreshing finish. Reminds me of how a key lime pie is both very tart but a treat at the same time. Light body bready big lemon zest coming through but very pleasant. Thanks for sharimg LagziLajcsi!
0.375l bottle. Hazy deep orange body, white head. Aroma of bread, lemon zest, green apples, funk and some earth. Taste of lemon juice, vinegar, earth, cheese, apples and salt. Very nice.

Very cloudy and chunky, ok from where it is from and to style, not good for an American lager to be this way. Sour and oakness. Some slight green apple and loads of acidic acid. Some salty residue on palate at end. Very complex funk tart and wood.

Piwo ma złocistą barwę, jest klarowne. Piana początkowo ochoczo się tworzy, jednak szybko redukuje się do obrączki. 
Aromat to mieszanka słodkich winogron i skwaśniałego siana czy zboża. Przypomina trochę szampan, ale dzikie, stajenne nuty są wyczuwalne i fajnie urozmaicają bukiet zapachowy. 
W smaku piwo jest smacznie kwaśne, owoce nadal są wyczuwalne, jednak dzika strona wydaje się bardziej uwydatniona. Jest siano, koński pot i stajnia - nie dominujące, ale wyraźne. Finisz wytrawny, kwaśny i lekko cierpki. Wydaje się, że po przełknięciu kwasek jest najwyższy i przypomina cytrynowy.
Bottle.Pours golden with small white head. Aroma is sour and salty, vinegar, raw apples, dung. Taste is sour, some saltiness, some spicyness. Medium body. Good one.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 Hazy golden / light orange with a vanishing sparkling head. Flavour is sourdough, cellar notes, wood, a hint of cooling mint in the end. Low sweetness and average sourness, that is not overwhelming at all. Light bittter finish and long lasting mouth watering sourness. Easy gueuze, highly drinkable and tasty.

rerate 03/2016
Good gueuze. Dry, citric, sour. But nothing special either.
7-3-7-3-17=37

W aromacie świetne nuty owocowe, przede wszystkim winogrona, ale też lekka brzoskwinia, dojrzałe jabłko, leciutka dzikość, super! W smaku wytrawny, lekka derka z winogronowymi akcentami, średnia kwaskowatość, brakowało pestki na finiszu. Nie jest to top, ale piwo naprawdę świetne.

On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY for Zwanze Day. Yellowish golden pour, minimal head. Quite a bit of funk. Dry. A little barnyard-ish but not overly so. Not extremely tart but good sourness throughout.
Bottle @ brewery. Pours a hazy orange with a small, white head. Aroma is a lot of barnyard, appleskin, bile. Taste is sour with appleskin. Not too much so.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeerwocky. jasne, przejrzyste, z kiepska piana. w aromacie owocowosc (jakies pomarancze, brzoskwinie) i juz kwasnosc. w smaku kwasnosc bardzo wyczuwalna, choc nie jakas ekstremalna ale niewatpliwie dominujaca. owoce z aromatu tez czuc. bardzo lekkie i orzezwiajace, malo ciala, srednie wysycenie, na koncu lekka goryczka. dobre. Rami Rami is drinking a Gueuze 100% Lambic Bio by Brasserie Cantillon at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaNo nudna belgia, ale jak rzeeeeeeskoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
On tap at zwanze day. Light yellow with hazy orange. No head. Sour Apple, strong birch leaves. Strong sour taste, dry finish. Sour lips. Excellent once passed the sour hit. Cheers

2014, 37,5cl bottle. 
Slightly hazy, rather light orange. White small head.
Mild tartness in aroma, hints of lemon, some funk. A lot going on in the taste, lemon, medium sourness, a zesty "bitterness" in the end (which I think clashes some with the rest of the experience, felt the same with 3F Geueze). Overall really enjoyable, fresh, medium/average carbonation.

On tap at Kyber Pass Pub as part of their "Wild on the Streets" event. Pours light orange with a one finger white head which fades to very little lacing. Aroma is of barnyard funk, wet hay, Greek yogurt, sour fruits, band aids, and vinager. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma with a pretty a pretty funky,wild taste. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a bome dry, sour, long, lingering finish. Overall, a tasty, complex, sour beer that I would of found gross a few years ago.

franchement, je tourne mal ! Je commence à vraiment bien aimer les gueuzes et la façon étrange quelles ont de titiller le palais. Je ne saurais comparer celle-ci avec dautres vu mon peu dexpérience en la matière ... Pour autant une jolie acidité de citrons en saumure sans le côté aigrelet désagréable ... ça fait énormément salivé et ça désaltère très efficacement !

37.5cl Rather fresh. Some 20 years ago I would have spat it out, and complained that my beautiful lager went totally spoiled and rancid. Now I am learning to appreciate and enjoy every single drop of every gueuze I can get my hand on. Strong cellar and oak aroma. Pours pale blond hazy with some head. Gently carbonated medium bodied taste bud tickler. I am desperate to get my hands on unblended. Love it. If you have not had any decent lambics lately - this is definitely a one to try.
On tap at Moeder Lambic. Poured lil hazy orange with white head. Aroma funky wet hay cow barn. Light carb med bod. Taste light refreshing bitter dry acid. Got alot going on in there

Aroma: resin, rowanberries, hay, white wine, mango
Appearance: no foam, murky golden, hazy
Taste: orange, orange peal, pine needles, firm bitterness, grapefruit, cranberries
Palate: mid bodied, low carbonation
Overall: Refreshing gueuze!

A sour lemon aroma with notes of honey and fruit. Pours a great looking gold color with a lasting white head. Amazing taste of lemons and notes of honey and peach. Sour taste with a medium and clean tart finish.

Poured from a rap. Clear golden color, medium white head. Nice tart aroma. Light body with a nice tart flavor and a. Clean refreshing finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The most classic Cantillon product I presume, one of the great archetypes of the oude geuze style, and it says a lot about Jean Van Roy that he even refuses to use the legally designated phrase "oude", thereby ostentatiously ignoring the fact that there are many sweetened deviations from the original geuze. I must have enjoyed this one many dozens of times in the past fifteen-odd years, but suddenly noticed I hadnt even rated it here yet... Shame on me for overlooking such a world classic. Hazy peach golden colour with fine sparkling like a lambrusco, supporting a thin but moussy, off-white head, breaking open but (at least initially) retaining well on the edges and leaving a greyish veil over the liquid. Fairly strong and very funky aroma exactly like I remember it: wine vinegar, lemon juice, wet wood, fino sherry, white grape peel, wet hay, horseblanket, unripe stonefruit, musty cellar, stale sweat, steeped lentils, lots of redcurrant and gooseberries - an acquired taste, but as lambicy as can be. Puckering acidity in onset, very lemony, softening after a while but lasting till deep into the throat, with medium but finely tingling carbo again like lambrusco and paired with an array of fruity esters: redcurrant, white grape, green plum, starfruit. Lean and supple bready and wheaty middle phase upon which a complex of lasting fruity esters and a mellow, yoghurty lactic acidity are built; grows more and more woody in the end, drying along with the sourness, though a juicy, bready maltiness remains, as well as a powdery, dusty yeast feeling. A very deeply buried but palpable, very earthy old hop bitterness further dries the finish and lasts for quite a while, deaf and not providing any aroma, as is custom for the style. Unforgettable, this is just like I remember it, though I did have more acidic editions - or maybe that is just my palate having grown used to sour beers throughout the years. Whatever the case, this is one of those classics in every sense of the word, though perhaps not the most accessible example of its style. I hope it will stay around for a long time to come, as an advertisement of Belgian lambic culture, which was basically the last sour beer culture to survive before sour beer styles were taken up by the new craft beer movement.
(bottle) clear, bright orange amber with a medium tall; white head; lively carbonation; aroma of fruit, then funk and dough; sour and refreshing favout with a long, light sour and bitter finish
Bottle. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma sour, vinegary, some goosebery in the begining. Taste sour, bitter in the end. Some woody tones. Good one.

Bottle. Barely hazy golden colour. Aroma lightly fruity, acetic, light vinegary. Taste is very nicely balanced, only (relatively) light sourness, pleasant fruity acetic combination. Leathery. Very good. Sourness quickly leveled in the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Bottle at cantillon. Pours hazy pale orange, nose is light funk, citrus, taste is dry, horseblanket, quite smooth.3.7
Keg at six degrees north. funky, wood, lemon, juicy.

Clear golden liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of vinegar, oak. Taste: apple vinegar. light sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour. Palate: light body, creamy, average carbonation, long sour finish,

0,375 bottle, Bottling date: 1. december 2014. Gift from Christian H.B. (This is my 300.th rating)

Pours a hazy orange color, real pretty! Aroma is sour, lactic with apples, some tropical fruit, peach, funky barnyard, hay and lemons. When i taste it i get hit with tons of flavor that develops in the mouth. Lemon meringue pie, grapes, grapeskin, sour green apples, acidity, vinegar, vanilla, salty, woodiness. Theres just so much here, and its masterfully balanced. Nothing in particular dominates the palate! Finishes dry. Amazing.

Aroma: barnyard, hay, lemon, fruity
Taste: heavy sour, refreshing, lemon, hay, fruity

La prima volta per una cantillon, primo impatto un acidità molto intensa che ne discosta dalle solite birre, poi piano piano ti fai la bocca e rimane un piacevole gusto. Ottima geuze equilibrata e acida al punto giusto. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

Samplöed at the Cantillon brewery.
Short white head, solid golden color. Clean lactic acidity in both aroma and taste. The aroma also has a bit woody notes. Fresh.
Excellent representation of the style, but i just like 3Fs better . The brett character on Bio is not as strong, but you do get the big sour bite right up front.

Bottle as Cantillon Gueuze 100% Lambic Bio, kindly donated by Santa SlackerMads. Vintage 2014. Hazy orange golden color with small white head. Tart aroma of grapes, oranges, funk, barnyard. Tart taste with lemon, grapes, vinegar, sour apples, sea salt, wood, Long astringent sour finish. Tasty.
World class yes, sour patch art lemon aroma. Great super dry champagne like palate. Taste of salty goaty cheesy funk. Ends of a super tart mango dry finish.

drank on: 26.07.15

This beer is fantastic. Love the smell, the look, and the way it drys out your mouth.
tried 3 different cantillons and didnt care for any of them. apparently this just isnt my kinda thing.

tart lemony, hay, complex like any other geuze.
taste is tart, complex, musty notes, breadiness. long lingering tartness
MF; soft creamy, carbonated.
Slightly hazy dark golden. Small white head, sparkling. Acetic aroma, fruity and funky. Sour, acetic flavour. Lemon with a sharp sourness and a tart, bitter finish.

Aroma: Medium sourness, barnyard, tart. Light spicy, peppery.
Appearance: Slightly hazy gold body. Small, off-white head.
Flavour: Medium-light sourness, light barnyard, tart. Well balanced.

375 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
17E. Gueuze
Classy geuze! Bit acidic fruity - berry like sourness. Lovely lemon, mango, wood. Finishes more tart and quite dry. Enjoyable brew.

Bottled 1 Dec, 2014; drunk 10 July, 2015 at Känguruh in Vienna, Austria. 0.375l pour into Belgian challice. Pours a bright orange, moderately hazy, with no head to speak of. Nose is musty. Like a winter coat pulled out of the closet in August. Barnyard and dirt. Maybe even a hint of manure or moldy cheese. These dont sound like good things, but strangely they work fairly well. Body is thin, crisp, and tart. Biting. Taste is intense. Starts out tart and gets tarter. Tastes like sour oranges, maybe sour cherry, some hay, and ends with a bit of dirt. Hard for me to describe accurately beyond intense. Complex. A beer made for sipping.
My favorite! This gueuze is special. And if you have the chance to taste it at Cantillon, in Brussels, the experience is even more magnificent.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 23E). Bottle 37.5 cl - Bottle on 03 June 2014. AROMA: moderate sour aroma with stable notes (horsy and goaty), some leather and touches of apple. APPEARANCE: goldenm color and translucent. average ehite head with low retention for the style. TASTE: initial sour flavour balanced with brett notes (barnyard, goat and leather). low bitterness with a dry and tart finish. PALATE: light body with a high tart quality but not astringent. medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a somewhat balanced traditional gueuze with all the Brettanomyces Bruxelensis characteristics.

0,375 l bottle as "Gueuze 100% Lambic Bio" from P&M Getränke, bottled in june 2014 (one year old). Clear, apricot-coloured with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Intense, sourish-fruity and funky aroma of lemon, oak, gooseberry and fermented apples. Sourish, funky taste of lemon, fermented apples, goosebery and oak, followed by a long, very tart finish. Thin to medium body, spritzy and astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Heavily sour, but also quite fruity and highly refreshing. I cannot yet compare it, but I just love it. Great stuff!

Vintage 2006 dégusté sur place en compagnie de 2 comparses fort sympathiques. Bouteille sans étiquette de laquelle jaillit un liquide orange et très effervescent! Magnifique! Arômes complexes de bois, dun lambic attendri par le temps, légèrement fruité et chaud. Je nai jamais senti des arômes aussi délicates provenant dune gueuze. Cest à se jeter par terre! En bouche, cest doux, moelleux, boisé sans être chênu, délicat... Cest ni acide ni aigre, simplement sûr sagement âgé. Longue en bouche, magnifiquement balancé, je vis un moment magique dans les caves de lune des plus grandes brasseries de ce monde!

0,375 cl bottled 27. August 2013. Cloudy orange in the glass, small white head. Surish tartness on the. Taste is nearly the same with a fruity mid dry bitterness. Crisp. Increasing sourness. Nice one.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 2014 bottle. Little hazy orange color, almost no head. Super funky aroma, leather, horse blanket, barnyard and all that wild stuff. Also small vinegar note. Taste is medium to high sour, dry and tart. Flavor of lemon, green apples, wine, oak, light vinegar finish. Aftertaste is dry and tart. Light body, soft carbonation. Very complex beer, give lots of plesure and fun. One of best.
2012 bottle shared at Chriss bachelor party. Super funky smell, lacing thin head, golden body. Nicely balanced. Not my favorite style but drinkable. Sour and tart elements without being harsh.

Appearance: pale, golden, hazy, minimal head.
Taste: medium sourness, lightly bitter.
Palate: lively, medium body.

375 ml bottle at Waterhuis aan de Bierkant in Gent. Hazy straw with small white head, poor retention. Sour aroma: lemons, hay, green apples. Taste is very sour: concentrated lemon juice, lactic acid, green grapes. A little too extreme for me.
Bottle shared with mom. Pours Pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is sour, tart, citrus. Taste is the same, with a vingegar pleasnt felling. very good!

Hazy, straw color and small head. Medium intensive aroma of sourness, acid apple, wheat and horse blanket. Taste is minimal sweet, medium to heavy sour and medium to heavy dry. High carbonation. Medium body. Very refreshing, sour and well balanced gueze. Very good stuff.
Pours a hazy yellow gold color with white fizzy head. Funk, tartness, and citrus acidity and fruit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 1e Cantillon, die ik proef, Gueuze 100% Lambic Bio, uitgeschonken in Cantillon degusteer glaasje. Goudgele, honingachtige iets troebele kleur, met kleine en dunne witte schuimkraag die snel wegtrekt, een dunne ring van schuim blijft op het bier drijven. De geur is bijzonder, witte wijnachtig, bierkelder/barnyard, hooi, citroengras, zelfs ook kaasachtige aroma's. De smaak is complex, de eerste tonen zijn behoorlijk zuur en kort daarop vrij bitter. Door de behoorlijke carbonatie heeft het iets weg van brut champagne, maar dan met meer zuur en bitter erin. Tonen van citrusfruit; citroen, limoen en grapefruit. Witte wijnazijn en wat houtige tonen, met een zeer droge en subtiel bittere hopfinish. Fraai en erg mooi gebalanceerd Gueuze Lambic bier, ik ben benieuwd naar de andere Cantillon varianten die ik ook nog in het wijnrek heb liggen. De Gueuze blijft een bijzondere biersoort en deze Cantillon is een perfecte keuze voor de liefhebber van deze artisanale bieren. Een bezoek aan de brouwerij staat zeker ook op de planning als ik in Brussel ben.

37.5cl bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour with a thin white head. Sour, brett and acid citrus in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is a multi layered experience with tart notes and some acid feeling. Overall, a good lambic.
Hell, gelb, trüb. In der Nase Stinkekäse, Heu, würzige Noten, Säure, Hefe. AM Gaumen sauer, trocken, Zitronensäure, leicht süß, Heu, trockener Abgang.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 How: tap Appearance : hazy light golden. Aroma : herbs, citrus, minerals, earthy. Palate : light body, average carbonation.

Beautifully aromatic with a sourish lemon tickle up nose. Undoubtedly tart but not harsh and there is some citrus sweetness later. But it tickled the tongue. To be shared. Oh so good. 3std drks, 750bottle, 5%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted a sample at the brewery in Brussels.
Zesty, earthy and woody on both - the nose and the palate.

Bottle (375ml) at Porch Nite thanks to Raith which he purchased at the brewery. Pours a clear yellowish with a very thin head. High carbonation. Aroma is lemons, tartness, slight hay and lemongrass. Flavor follows and is lemony and quite tart. Finishes really dry. A very nice beer.
Sample @ Cantillon 150515. Fruity and bretty, sour, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is long and tart, fruity and bretty.

Moss,sourness in aroma. Strong almost citryssy aroma. Amber color on light side. Tart sourness in taste bit of grapefruit peel. Mold maybe also. Refreshing. Difficult layers of taste. Gets better after few sips.
Sour but also barnyard like (difficult to describe but v.good). Pretty sour. Cloudy yellow, little foam.

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. The pour from this 750 mL bottle is a hazy golden yellow color with a smaller white head. The aroma is pretty damn good. There is a lot of sour, Brett, and some lemon or citrus on the back end. The flavor is much of the same. Its really sharp and tart with some grapes in there with the lemon. I am also picking up some apple peel. The mouth feel is a little light, and the carbonation doesnt seem like its up there as high as it should be. The aftertaste is lingeringly sour and fruity. This is a damn good beer. Wish I had more Cantillon

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 375 ml bottle, 5 months old. Hazy golden body, medium to small head. Mildly acidic aroma with classic Lambic elements, nothing out of the ordinary. Pleasantly tart taste without getting excessively sour. Sweet and sour with a mixture of various apples in their different stages: from raw green ones to the ripe red ones and later even some that are almost starting to rot. Pleasantly tart finish. Highly drinkable.
Yellow-orange, hazy, white head. Aroma of mirabelle and brett, quite sour, unripe mirabelle. Soft carbonation. A very clean and crisp lambic without any off flavours. Very good.

At the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy darker golden color, topped with virtually no head to speak of. Cellary aroma, earthy with some grape notes. Taste has some sweetness in there, but characterized by a decent sourness. Not for everyone, but if you can appreciate something completely different, then quite enjoyable.
Smell is light to moderate sourness, oak, and brett. Taste is pretty much the same with the sourness being the dominant note. Medium body, low to medium carbonation, and light foam.

Golden honey coloured, cloudy, with a big but quickly fading white head. Smells of sour apples and white wine vinegar. Big yeast presence too. Light body, moderate carbonation but feels zinger due to the tartness. Apples, lemon, hint of sour cherry in the taste. Nice transition from sour to woody dryness. Best sour beer Ive had - complex and interesting.

Degustata in bottiglia da 37.5 centilitri. Centopercento lambic scritto sulletichetta e lo è anche in realtà a partire dallaroma perfettamente disgustoso proprio come deve essere! Il pore non delude col giusto livello di acidità che si tramuta in un aroma inconfondibile al palato che ti dà la giusta spinta per bene ancora un bicchiere se non addirittura una bottiglia unica pecca è nel nostro caso la poca schiuma. Colore paglierino, opaco. Odore di straccio, chiuso, cantina e agrumi.

2015/05/01 - On tap at Moeder Lambic in Brussels. Golden yellow colour with a head that quickly vanishes. Aroma of lemon, honey, hay and barnyard. Taste is lots of tart lemon and some mild barnyard funk. Mouthfeel is medium with mildly biting carbonation and a tart, acidic finish with a slight funk aftertaste. Love the tart crispness.

0,375L bottle, dated 28.11.2013 (from Wines of Galilee). Pours golden with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sour, vinegar. Flavor is sour and bitter, medicinal, citrus, lemon, somewhat spicy even. Overall: good one.

spruce, cheese, raisin, pale, golden, hazy, minimal head, heavily sour, very bitter, light body, thin feel, flat, astringent,. Probably a lovely beer for those who like this, but it was wasted on me unfortunately.

Colore giall paglierino, poca schiuma bianca e fine che scompare rapidamente. Aroma di cantina, sudore, leggero legnoso, limone, fiori di campo. Al palato corpo leggero, lieve frizzantezza che aiuta la bevuta, di nuovo sentori di cantina, limone, acidità spiccata, fiori.

Cantillon brewery

375ml bottle. Hazy golden body with a brief white head. Barnyard, lemon, hay, citrus peel with a nice acidity.
Simply one of the best examples of tipycal Gueuze. Tough yeasts, heavy sour, astringent and bitter finish
Cor dourada, turva, boa espuma. Aroma intenso de vinagre, madeira e frutas secas. Paladar extremamente ácido. Retrogosto marcante e seco. Diferente!!!

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2015 Botella @Cimmeria, Oviedo 16/04/2015 Embotellada: 3 june 2014

75 cl bottle in a park in paris. Pours a hazy golden orange with a small white head that quickly becomes just a film of head. Beautiful aroma, tart lemon, barnyard, wet hay, some cheesy hops i believe, lemon pie almost, crackers. Flavour is strong tart lemon, white grape peel, tart apples, dried apricots, funky brett. 2014 bottle so still young but very awesome.

Divinity; I think geuzes are the definition of a divine beer. And this one is near perfect. Nice orange beer, creamy white head. Vinegar, sour appels, lemon, grapes its al there. It feels round and creamy combined with the champagne like carbobation. And the taste stays around for a long time. Yum.

375 ml bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into a snifter. Earthy citrus aromas with hints of pear and white wine vinegar. Sour and dry on the palate with a nice slightly fruity and sour finish. Great stuff!

Very earthy and complex, even though oak is not a prominent flavor, it is more detected in Cantillons Gueuze than others. 


Slightly citrusy with big barnyard and funk, not super sour and very nice mouthfeel for a gueuze. 

Had several vintages of it, and fresh I think this isnt among the best, but when aged it improves drastically - 9, 6 and 3 year old are on a whole other level than fresh.
Ya llevo unas cuantas y cada vez me gustan mas. Sabor acido pero no muy astringente. Olores a sidra o champang.

On 37,5 cl bottle at Cafe Gollum. Hazy golden color, ok foam. Medium/high aroma intensity; stable , some autumn leaves, some light citrus and apricot. Medium body & medium : high complexity. Good sourness, high bitterness. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy yellow beer, white head. Barnyardy notes un the nose with wport and vinous notes, citrus, lemons. Flavor is lemons, tartness, acidity, apricot tartness. Pretty nice. Shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

750ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of skullgeorge. Light hazy golden orange color with white head. Aroma is funky, barnyard, tart fruity, dusty, citrusy fruity - lemon. Sweet, light acidic, mostly dry and light bitter taste, funky fruity like aroma, peach, lemon, orange. Light to medium almost oily body with average carbonation.
A lot of green apples, vinegar and a distinct sourness. I usually like cantillon alot, but this time i got a bit dissapointed. Its a bit to anonymous, dont know if it was a bad bottle or what?

Botella de 375 compartida con mis padres. Color melocotón pajizo. Espuma de media baja formación y cero persistencia. Aromas a sidra, champagne, madera, algo herbal, (en global me recuerda un poco al aceite de freír chuletillas jajajaja)...en boca textura aquosa- aceitosauna pasada de matices...los mismos q en aroma pero mas complejos, tb aparece algunos q recuerdan a queso!!! Final astringente Birrote!!

Gueuze de libro. Se repite la historia. Repito mis sesiones. Jamás me decepciona, especialmente últimamente, cuando noto menos su acidez y más sus matices, más su complejidad. Algo hace clic en mi cabeza: ahora entiendo porqué para el entendido es un gran estilo.
Some kind of lemon aroma with a little barnish hint. Clear with a adequate head. Sour with dry finisz. Very good example of Gueze.
Pours a slightly cloudy golden yellow color. Aroma and taste are nice sourness and a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 Aromat: końska derka, stajnia, mokre siano, drewno. Wspaniały.
Wygląd: jasne złoto z piękną pianą. 
Smak: ogromnie wytrawne, ogromnie kwaśne, musujące, czuć wszystkie dzikie nuty świata, do tego lekką owocowość. Wspaniale pijalne i orzeźwiające. Brak dosładzania to tylko zaleta. 
Jedno z najlepszych piw jakie dane mi było pić.

Na 3 fonteinen de beste geuze die er is. Heerlijk bier!

De afdronk op het einde is soms iets té scherp maar valt goed te doen.
Hazy and at the same time clear liquid, small head. Aroma is fresh and sour. Medium body, little carbonation. Taste is sweet, sour and soft.
une magnifique gueuze typée, avec un nez complexe, une bouche raffraîchissante, une grande longueur et un équilibre idéal. Un grand plaisir pour finir la soirée

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a cloudy, orangey straw color, with a modest, quickly diminishing layer of soft white, bubbly head foam, and light spots of lacing. The aromas intro was one of light yeast with a hint of cheese-like funk, then tartness & dryness, with esters as citrusy lemon, and a blend of green apple & pit fruit. Medium bodied, and highly effervescent, the taste continued with fruit notes as the nose, quite dry & citrusy, with lingering tartness. A flavorful gem enjoyed by all at our tasting session.

Pale golden color with a minimal and quickly diminishing white head. Aroma has notes of green apple with acidic notes. Flavor is fruity, slightly notes of citrus with a good vinegar mouthfeel. Easy drinkable
Bottle at the Earl Of Essex, London. This is an amazing beer, semi dry, sour to taste. A recommended beer.
Excellent beer! The perfect balance of sour. Cantillon definitely know what they're doing!

Big thanks to tectactoe. Bright yellow pour with a bright white foamed rim. A lemon zest huge funk aroma. Perfect acidity. Immediately settles with a sweet bubblegum. Grassy sour notes. White grape tartness. Dry finish. Really drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Cloudy golden-yellow color with little foam. Smell is sour and not too intense with additional old feet flavors. The taste a little dry and it is exactly the right amount of sour with fitting carbonation. The aftertaste could be longer and more sour, but this is complaining at irresponsible high levels.

Bottle at home (bottled 2014, shared). Pours a clear golden orange yellow with a white, fizzy, fast disappearing head. Fruity, slightly tart aroma, yeast, barnyard. Light sour, fruity, vineous taste, yeast with a dry, light sour, ending and somewhat bitter aftertaste. Not bad.
Nez frais et rond. En bouche, on perçoit lacidité légère des jeunes lambics, avec de belles notes grillées, toastées, boisées, caractéristiques des vieux lambics.

Copenhagen 19/10 2014. Bottle brought by ny brother in law (bucket of beer). Looks a bit like morning urine. Hazy with almost no head. Very distinct sour aroma. Dull mouthfeel due to low carbonation. Very strong citrus and lemon taste and sour Belgian aftertaste. At first quite unconfortable - But it gets better after your mouth gets used to it. My first queze - a quite special experience.

"Cantillon 100% Lambic" bottle. Hazy light golden body, fine thin head. Strong yeasty aromas, cheese, vinegar, citrus, some horse blanket, with flowers and green fruit in the background. Moderatley sweet, nicely acidic and refreshing, dry and slightly astringent/salty finish. Amazing. Slightly challenging for non-lambic lovers due to the initial sourness but still balanced and easy to drink. Overall impression is excellent.

2013 vintage. Poured from a 375cc bottle at Mikkeller bar. Pours hazy orange with minimal off-white head. Nose is sour apple, lemon, grape skin, barnyard, and apple vinegar. Flavour is tart green apple, lemon zest, and grass. Beautiful ascerbic sour!
Tart, fresh and phenolic in equal measure. World class. Would win awards as a cider. Challenging and drinkable at the same time. Dont drink too much or too early the hangover is a killer.
Ravgul, klar, greit skum. Syrlig aroma med preg av fjøs, epler og sitrus. Syrlig og frisk, med noe sødme i avslutningen.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with a medium white head. Aromas of tart green apples, lots of funk, stable, vinegar, some floral notes. Taste is tart green apples, lots of vinegar, stable, funk, slight leather. Medium carb.
