UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Mon premier "Overall" parfait, 20/20. Cette bière représente, en effet, parfaitement ce que jaime : une complexité exemplaire associée à une facilitée de boire incroyable. Jaimerais avoir accès à des bouteilles de cette bière 365 jours par année! Le côté sûrette et citronné est totalement balancé et nest aucunement agressif. Le corps et limpression en bouche sont si parfaits quil est prèsque difficile dy porter attention : tout se concentre sur les saveurs! Ce nest peut-être pas la plus rares des Cantillon, mais cest malgré tout celle qui me plait le plus de cette brasserie jusquici.

Chapeau... une très, très grande bière!

Bottle @ home. Pours with a bright orange beautiful colour, small white rocky head. Aroma is very rich in typical lambic aromas: very strong leather, basement aromas, some fruit in the background. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly bitter, medium sour. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2015 Bottle 37,5 cl shared with Fabien G. @ Le Barboteur. Probably one of the best gueuze, complex, tasty. Great!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Classic Gueuze . Very good. Sour, apple, delicious. Very pleasant sourness.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2015 Traditional gueze produced by 100% lambic, this Cantillon represents the perfect beer brew with 35% of wheat malt and 65% of barley malt and characterised by spontaneous fermentation. Balanced acidity and no strongly intense aroma of Bret or lactobacillus. Optimum with green and blue cheese.

from tap at Akkurat. such a fantastic beer! thin lasting head, vinuous funky nose, bright carbonation, delicious. the hype is for real. this beer is ideally balanced, refreshing, smooth sourness in the finish, salty barnyard funk (in a good way). I followed this up with a draft saison dupont (one if my favorite beers of all time) and it tasted like estery water in comparison, so I had to get another geuze. world class art.
Funky, hazy and delicious. A sweetness to the aroma and the tart is pretty subdued. A bit of funk on the finish, but real nice indeed

37,5cl fles gedeeld met een vriend
Alcoholpercentage van 5%
Uitgeschonken in Belle-Vue glas

Uiterlijk: goudoranje zonder schuim

Aroma en smaak: azijn, fruitig als vers uitgeperste citroen, extreem zuur

Conclusie: zeker niet mijn type bier, rare nasmaak ook

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draught (!) at Gollem by Rembrandtplein. Carbonation is super lively. Strong aroma of fruit and barn. Has this really unique tingle on the back of your mouth when you drink it. Inimitable.
Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured a cloudy pale golden color with a small white head. The aroma was of funk, fruit and some wood. The taste was of citrus, apple, funk, and more wood.

Tap at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Poured a crystal clear light amber with a big initial frothy white head. The aroma is lemon citrus sour.... a delicate introduction to what comes later! The flavour is strong acid sour with a clean crisp refreshing pure acid citrus palate. Its not as sour as I was expecting but it still had a good go at taking the lining off the back of my throat! Ill confess that Im no "sour head" but this beer doesnt pull any punches. It is what it is. Its a very refreshing sour that makes a statement which is "I dont care if you dont like me" !

(sample from bottle, thanks Blade86) Yellow, hazy colour. Small, yellow , stable foam. Soft carbonation, medium body, watery to minimal oily textury. Aroma: Dry with medium strong notes of brettanomyces, flowers, white fruits, a pinch of oak. Taste: Dry, medium tart, medium sour increasing in finish. White fruits, pips, a pinch of oak and wooden tartness.

I never ate a rubber tire on fire, but I am pretty sure it will be close to the aftertaste of this beer. The main taste is close to the one from grape fruit juice, but without the good part. Not to be recommended.
First impression in the mouth is decent. But then we go down to some abysmal depth of rotten grapefruit slash melted tyre. The four of us couldn?t finish the bottle... It says a lot.
Geuze un peu sûre mais avec un mauvais goût rappelant le pamplemousse qui prédomine. Vraiment pas la meilleure des geuzes. Pénible à boire.
Refreshingly dry. All of the soury goodness to be expected of a good lambic. The more of it I drink, the more I notice and the more I love.

Sampled at Cantillon Brewery in Brussels. Pours hazy orange with a very thin head. Nose is sour. Tastes tart without being too acidic. Funky. The sweetness is restrained. Tasted this alongside the 1-yr lambic and as expected this is so much more complex. A wonderful lambic!
Not a huge fan of the lambics, but cantillon does an excellent job and this is no doubt a finely crafted brew. Consistent yet complex sour flavor.
Pours a hazy golden with a small white head, sour grape aroma with a lovely tart taste and dry finish.
375ml 2013 Belgian flag. Definitely the most barnyard funky sour Ive had. Seriously has a bit of horse piss. Mild sour and tartness. They make much better fruit sours.
Pours a clear golden. Aroma is sour, white wine like. Its highly carbonated, sour, dry finish.

Smells of prunes & caramelised morello cherries. The first taste is acidic & bitter but once your palate gets used to this combination it flows like a sour champagne with a bitter finish. Tastes like limes, pineapples & bitter grapefruit. A beer to have when you fancy a sparkling white wine!

Rated by BrewTom

Con Cantillon non si sbaglia mai, questo è sicuro. Bottiglia da 75 cl del 2014. Quando si parla di lambic e di gueuze in particolare non sto li a scrivere aromi e sapori identificati perchè mi viene sempre difficile farlo. Posso dire però che è una delle migliori (se non la migliore) gueuze che ho provato.

On Tap at the Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Nose classic Geuze, hints of oak, barnyard, light funk. Beautiful mouth feel marrying oak and acidity with some sweetness. Great stuff. Shame it's 7.20 per glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Couleur blonde avec un col assez résistant blanc. Aromes de céréales, fruits jaunes sures, acidité moyenne. Très stable et balancé. Une gueuze dans les règles de lart!

750ml bottle from Belgian e-shop
Have tried three time over two years, tasting note of latest.

The first ever Gueuze tried, having read about it and expecting what to taste, I was 100% satisfied.

Straw color with thin white head. Aroma starting grassy then cheesey, wet hay, intense barnyard, fruity. Taste is citrusy, tart and funky, not much acetic acid mostly lactic and complex, nice light sweetness too but acidic is amazingly overwhelming and satisfying. Aftertaste is very intense and lasting, reminding you to get another sip as fast as possible.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 An amazing Gueuze. Of course, its quite special, not for any occasion, it is very sour and dry. There is a lot of apple and raisin with a beautiful crisp nose. I prefer to drink it quite chilled even if they would have it almost room temperature in Cantillon. This Gueuze is great because it is so complex yet very simple straightforward taste without to much sweetness which can be a problem with other breweries...

draft and I hope this is the right one. poured a very slightly hazy yellow with white head that quickly disappears. the aromas are sour fruity tart lemon grassy. the flavor is dry tart sour lemony sour some really nice funk just a beautiful sour. now I see what all that fuss is about. truly a masterpiece.

duft : lidt æble lidt syre. lidt grøn duft druer. 
smag: lidt æble juice æble skral tør og bitter. mangler noget mere dybden hvis du skulle være bedre syntes jeg
Golden each pour with no head. Aroma is very mild funk and minerals. Taste is lovely savoury quality - peppery, funky, minerally. Very tasty gueuze without being intense. Solid stuff.
Corked 75 cl bottle @ home (2012 vintage). Pours hazy golden with a white head that leaves very little lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemons, tartness, vinegar, and oak - with a dry finish.

Bottle. Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Hazy orange. Film of white head. Mouldy lemon. Light, spicy, bready malt. Cherry stone. A bit sweaty. Taste is dry. Light acidity. Light bitter. Palate has some oiliness. Finishes dry, and soft acidic. Very drinkable. Very tasty.
Glass at brewery. Big head and small bubbles settling. Hazy yellow color. Aroma is strong of yeast and straw. Sour taste.

375, 750ml bottles. Several times along the years.
In short: gueuze.
So i missed this one and now i rate it. Wll, this was one of my first pure lambics. I loved it and i still do. A classic paradigma of its style, quite tart, dry, some fruity and lovely. Having it at Cantillon, with Jean Pierre Van Roy pouring it for you, shoud be enjoyed by any beerlover.

(0,75l bottled 16.3.2010) Hazy orange looks with delicate head on top. Aroma is really sour, excellent start! There is dry green apples, slight barnyard and citrus. Taste has citrus, green apples, sourness. Slight barnyard in the taste too. Some sweeter fruits pop up after warming up. Medium body with medium carbonation. Excellent lambic again from Cantillon.

At the brewery following the tour. Poured a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma of pear, apple, sourness, and mildy funky basement. Taste was lightly sour and fruity with a nice little bite to it. Body felt pretty light and it was easy to drink with a dry finish. Well done.

Bottle 0,5l. served in tulip. Aroma: Sour apple and pear, woody, sweet undertone. Apperance: Pours lightly hazed gold with a minimal white head. Taste: Dry, tart, citrus zest, apple, pear, brett. Palate: Medium body. Soft cabonation, lingering acetic sourness. A very nice and drinkable geuze.

Bottle of 75cl.
TEH Gueuze ! One of the greatest btw. Superbe taste of lambic, improved with the little sour, yeasted aroma. Nice and sweet palate.
Try it with two sugars. Beware of the ascending head :)
Tart and funky, hazy and delicious. A sweetness to the aroma and the tart is pretty subdued. A bit of funk on the finish, but real nice.
Bottle; pours a hazy gold with a thin white head; has a tart apple aroma; taste is also tart apple with some citrus notes; finish is sour and dry; drinks really smooth; very nice
Yeasty start, then sour, citrous and acidic. Not lot of body. Overall a good lambic.

Golden and bears a great resemblance to apple juice in the looks department.

Short lasting head.

Smell is lemon/lime. 

Taste is tart, sour and lime. Had this on tap at Moeder Lambic and much prefer it to bottled version; as it is not as harsh and pretty easy to drink.

(On tap at barVolo for Zwanze Day 2014, Sept 20 2014) Pours lightly hazed gold with a medium white head, lace. Aroma of sour pear, slightly rotten fruit, earth and light wood, funny salty buttered lobster aroma (!) over top, a little vinegar. Palate has loads of vinegar, lemon, crabapple, Brett barnyard, herbs restrained but lots of wood from mid-palate on, a bit of old bittering hop medicinal dryness. Lingering acetic acid. Actually rather funky throughout. Medium body with high active carb. I feel like this is one of the most acidic, earthy and funky of the Cantillon beers. There is a ton going on but its not as soothing and perfectly integrated as some of the others.

Drinking from tab at Borefts festival 2014.
The aroma is like sniffing a glass with champaign.
The unclear golden-orange beer has a small white head.
The taste is mainly sour. Some bitter underneath.
Medium carbonated.
Bottle version. Sour apple nose. Lime tart flavor, vinegar, dry sour finish. A quite well-rounded gueuze, pretty silky and accessible.

500ml bottle served in a chalice.
A: Pours a hazy yellow to beige color forming a big, white and bubbled head. Medium to low retention and many bubbled lacings left in the glass
S: Very fruity in the nose. Lambic yeasts. Grains, oak and vinegar and some notes of white wine
T: Complex. Sour, acid and extremely dry. Fruits (grapes), oak, Lambic style yeasts, vinegar, grains and, again, some notes of white wine
M: Light body, low ABV and high carbonation. Fruity ans sour aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Classic Gueuze. Quite sour but a Cantillon after all
[ BA Review @ 8/7/2010 ]
Cervesa àmbar amb toc taronja, aromes fruitats complexos com de poma i pera. En boca es àcida peró també una mica dolça i amarga, boníssima!

At the apparence gold beer with really light foam. Mix of flavours at the nose while its sour taste it is persistant with citric notes. This is a great belgian gueuze in which the sour taste is the greater one, nice to drink also during lunch. Cantillon is always a warranty.

Blond-jaune pâle, petite mousse qui dure longtemps.
Nez de brett typique de Cantillon, avec une petite fraîcheur pour une gueuze.
Goût reste léger et pas si agressif que la moyenne.
Un classique, une espèce détalon pour les autres gueuze.

Old rating rerated 10.10.2014, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry citrusy, oak, citrus peel, hay, mild vinegar, weeds, hops, flowers, hints of thinner. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish, citrus peel, oak, weeds, sour socks, mild vinegar, hay, flowers. Medium bitterness, slightly dry citrusy mouthfeel. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Rerated 2017-02-03: 4p 

2014-10-09: 4,4 Testing 2007 vs 2014 A: 2007, mussels, "seaweed", shellfish. 2014: Aluminum, funky, hay T: 2007, sour! No bitterness. Shellfish, vinegar. 2014, yeasty, sharp! :-D

Bottle from beergium.com. Smell is sour, citrusy and has some notes of wild flower. Pours hazy dark orange with a small, quickly dissolving, white head. Taste is a bit salty with a subtle tone of citrus. Sour but easy and drinkable. Palate has some sourness and really sticks to the tongue. Overall a pleasant beer but dosent really live up to my expectations of it.
Tap at Moeder Lambic, 6th October 14. Clean, refreshing and sour. This was very enjoyable, zest and sone good depth, liked this
Helder donker geel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is typisch geuze, zuur en krachtig met diepe fruitsmaak.
Bottle share at NG Wild Peach release. Pour is burnt orange with a small white head. Aroma and flavor of lemon zest, barnyard, hay, yeast, apple rind, citrus, and wood.

Light tart lemonade, negligible qualities of funk, yogurt, always tastes kinda like a berliner more than a real gueuze. Definitely one of the lesser straightforward gueuzes that Cantillon produces, but still tasty.

From notes. On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF for Zwanze Day. Surprised to see I have never rated this. 
Aroma has some subdued acidity with moderate herbal and earthy funk. Light lemon and orange peel with some hints of tropical fruit. 
Pours a cloudy orange with a large white head that displays good retention and light lacing. Non existent legs. 
Flavor has medium high acidity with some moderate barnyard funk. Some light herbal and earthy notes. Light citrus and tropical fruit character with a hint of oak. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice vintage and certainly better than the 2013 bottle I recently opened. Nice herbal notes with good, though young acidity.

"different yellow label w/guy falling off his stool...ciderish and funky tart aroma comes out of the popple after its popped. lively carbonation but little head. lots of baryard, lemon, granny smiths and funk in the flavor, yet still pretty light on the palate. missing the green olive taste, which is a good thing. if all in the style were like this, i could begin to see what the fuss is all about. pretty steep for a good beer, though."

375ml bottle from Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours light gold with slight haze. Aroma is bright and colourful, taste is hugely complex with berries, spice, vanilla, sour and a constantly evolving sweetness with a dry finish. A beautiful, mesmerising Gueuze.

Orange golden color, with a very quick disappearing head. Oaky aroma, sour gueuze. Sour taste, as the girardin. IMO the Boon Gueuze was better than those oak-conditioned gueuzes as Girardin and Cantillon.
Fat på Akkurat delad med @msbrindbergs. Dimmig guldfärgad vätska med lågt vitt skum. Doftar övermogen frukt, åt det sura hållet. Sur smak med en stor bitterhet. God men inte riktigt min grej.

Fat på Akkurat. 
Dimmig mörkgul vätska, vitt skum.
Doftar surt äpple, punkt. 
Smakar surt, punkt. 
Det vita fruktköttet på citronen ligger kvar och nöter. 
Inte min typ av öl...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Borefts 14. Pale golden with almost no head. Medium body with quite some carbonation. Very present sourness with some bitter tones. Citrus, apple, grass and funk. A sour quality brew.

20/11/13 dated 37cl bottle to champagne tulip, the gueuze pours a turbid orange with a white fizzling head that disappears leaving no lacing. Aroma consists of apple, sour funk, lemon/orange peel, latex gloves, some floral aromas as well. Pretty complex but not as wowing as the fruit blended lambic. Taste is sour but not bracingly so...however there is a slight plastic element there in the background, though mostly overshadowed by the sour elements and other complexities. Beer is definitely palatable, how can you not like Cantillon? Mouthfeel is very dry, co2 is quite low, but its very drinkable and refreshing. Overall, great beer but I prefer the fruit versions. This is complex but the fruit additions give it more depth.

Draft at Zwanze day 2014, birch bar norfolk VA. Pours a clear peach color with an off white head. Tart aroma, citrus, funk, hay. Sour funk flavor. Citrus, long lingering tartness in the finish. Solid.
On tap at Zwanze day. Comes a somewhat cloudy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of funk, fruit, and wood. Taste is citrus, apple, funk, and wood. Very nice.
Tap at Scheras Zwanze day. Pours yellowish gold. Smells of barnyard funk with some apple. Taste sour and tart with astringent finish. Really enjoyed this.

Vintage 2009, draught at Akkurat. Pours cloudy golden. Strong sour aroma with notes of apple cider and grapes. Vinous taste with grassy notes and strong acidity. Funky, sour and quite frankly pretty damn awesome.

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Before Zwanze 2014. Aromas of musty basement, lactic acids, light grass clippings and moldy straw. 
The flavor to,me is just like it smells. Very tart and lactic with a drying palate. Thankfully no vinegar. Nice mild puckering. The best thing I can say about this brew is it was real drinkable for me and Im not a sour head by any means. This is balanced enough that I drank 8 oz. which is an enormous accomplishment. No really it is, pretty amazing.
9/20/2014. On tap at The Birch, Zwanze 2014. Golden yellow with a whie head. Mellow, funky aromas with hints of oak. Not overly tart. So balanced and complex. Long dry finish.

Tap @ Zwanze 2014 Grimstad. Pale orange, slightly cloudy, small white head. Tart aroma with dried hay and faint citrus. Taste is heavy acidic / sour. Notes of barnyard and sweaty stables. Light and fizzy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Bottled September 2011. Gold-orange hazy color with small head. Funky, tart aroma. It has the special something in it. Great dry, complex, sourly taste, with a little wood in it. Medium carbonation, amazing for an evening in the good weather. 4.6 Ive had some more of these (including on tap) which did not impress me as much but I let the rating stand so far because for some reason, that bottle got me. Maybe it was the age. We will see. The others were more around 3.9-4.2. In general, lots of plain lemons in there, which many other Gueuzes don?t have.2007 bottle at the brewery. Lots of lemon rind, burnt rubber. Still very nicely balanced and complex.

August 11, 2014. Bottle at Akkurat as Cuvée de Florian.
Pours hazy orange with a very small white head. Aroma is tart citrus, funk, barnyard, hay, notes of cloud berries, all nicely blended together. Taste is medium tart citrus and apple, barnyard and dry woody notes. Finish is dry and tart with a subtle complex funkiness. Medium bodied, oily texture and quite fizzy small bubble carbonation.

Do I have to say something... Ryan you suck!
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a hazy golden burnt orange color with a slim one finger white foamy head that dissipated quickly. Lacing, what lacing...none whatsoever. 
The smell, whoah, what the flying fuck, is this supposed to smell like this? Pure putrid foul smelling vinous shit. 
The taste was exactly the same. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with no sessionability whatsoever, wow - people actually like this shit. 
Overall, all I have to say is: to the brewer - how many times did your parents drop you on your head that you thought you had to come up with this shit? Keep your shit out of Alaska!

What else is there to say about this absolutely fantastic brew that sadly doesnt come into my life more often though I really wish it would because I would go to the store and purchase it with the money that I have in my wallet and now I am done with this run-on-sentence. FANTASTIC GUEZE!!!!
Paille, feuilles mortes et des veines chlorophyllées. Elle est quand même assez acétique, du bon côté de la limite avec une bonne présence citrique et verdoyante.

Burnt orange, fizzy pour with a thin white head. Lemon, apple, hay, yeast, slight stale/funky aroma. Sweet and tart on the palate. Really is a balanced explosion of sweet, tart and zing. Just fantastic.

White head, with big bubbles throughout the hazy gold liquid. Aroma is sweet and sour, with tart berry notes, absent most of their fruity components. A bit like boysenberry, really. Taste is very tart, and acidic, with hay notes. It etches the palate, and fades away to a clean aftertaste. 4 years old, bought at the brewery, and consumed for rating #1776. Sic semper tyrannis!

Pours a slightly cloudy golden amber with a short head diminishing immediately to a thin skim, no lacing. Nose is slight barnyard funk, woody notes, apple and citrus. Taste is tart and sour, funk, and citrus. Medium body and low but sustained carbonation, puckering and dry finish.

Bloody marvellous. Tangy and tart, with a pleasant funk. The standard by which gueuze is measured, and with good reason. I dont see how this can be given anything but full marks.
bottle. nice woody nose. taste is the same with the funk subdued and the wood stands out. Really smooth and drinkable.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 Pale orange pour with a little bit of a very fast vanishing head, aroma is a strong winey character less present at taste, taste is sour, acidic, funk/barnyard and citrus. 
Paired alongside some sushi and some italian prosciutto and pancetta. Other one tasting with me said its better with sushi.
Complex, rich, mouthfeel is really pleasurable, strong barnyard character, incredible.
UPDATED: OCT 8, 2015 First of this style. Outstanding flavor. Makes me want to go to Belgium. Sour and almost dirty sock flavor that combines for a perfect beer.

375ml bottle (8/2013 vintage) pours hazy toasted orange with a finger of head. Nose is musty wood funk, lemon, apple, citrus, hay, toasted bread crust, old attic floorboards. Taste is balanced tart acidity, lemon crisp, dry old wood, old wood closet funk, citrus, lime, apple. Finish is dry dusty barrel, funky apple, grain, stale bread, soft tartness. Fantastic.
@DØE Århus Syd: Very sour beer with flavors of green apples. Tart but not sour vinegar.
2013 bottle labeled Gueze. Brilliant pale orange. Sour, fruity tannic nose. Very bright and awesome. Sour, balsamic vinegar and oak tannin all across the palate. The definition of Gueze

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste sour, citrus, tart. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy lemon with negligible head. Aromas of sour apples. Taste sour with some tempering sweetness. Very little carbonation. Finish quite puckering and acerbic..

Blonde aux reflets jaunes foncés. La pomme surette, la Granny Smith et la poire asiatique sautent aux narines. Des notes de terre noire et de plate-bande nous donnent lenvie de jardiner! Attaque vive, franche, qui se perpétue dans une superbe allonge. Un classique!
Strong sour aroma. Yellow / light amber with medium whire cap, which fastly disapperas. Sour cider type taste with a strong citrusy bitter note on the last half of tongue.
Excellent....sour but balanced with slight moldy wood. Some blue chesse aroma very complex yet balanced. Flavor of lemon grapefruit citrus. great!

375ml Belgian flag bottle in Paris July 2014. Dark gold. The aroma starts with grass, hay and a tart,funk element that's cut with strong lemon zest. The taste follows suit with strong citrus acidic notes. The tartness and funk balance each other perfectly and as the beer warmed up pepper and wood notes came out. The mouthfeel was nice and light with high carbonation. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Staminee de Garre, Brugge. Pours slightly hazy light amber with small white head. Clear, vinous aroma, with subtle notes of fruit and touches of hops. Vinous flavour with dusty notes and touches of leaves, as well as bitter, hoppy hints. Dry and sourish, but rather mild, aftertaste. Low carbonation. Decent, indeed.

Bottle @ home 20140720. 2013. Pours cloudy golden with a dense medium head.Aroma: A little rotten at first, then green apples, a minimal funkiness. Taste is old apples, oaky tannins very slight funk. Dry and astringent, a little thin. It feels like something is missing in the middle. More funk would perhaps have been nice.

Bottle at home. Delightful geuze and way sharper and tarter than I remember. Real lip puckering stuff. Big sour apple and musty lemon, hay, dust. Really long dry finish complimented by fine carbonation. Classic fare.

Blonde aux reflets orangés et bien trouble, une mousse mince ne tient pas à étirer sa présence bien longtemps. Un nez fruité (pommes, raisins, citrons) et de terre (gazon mouillé) fait saliver. En bouche, cest explosif et rafraîchissant, notamment grâce à lacidité et à la sécheresse importante de cette bière. Un grand classique à boire à grandes lampées.
Pours a matte golden yellow with no head. Nose is sour apple with citrus and yeast. Taste sour apple with a sudden attack of sourness that perfectly smoothes toward the end of a fruity after taste.

Thanks to joedevivre for share. Beautiful beer. Gold color. Tart fruit, lemon, earth funk, sour apple on the nose. Taste is slightly sour, but with nice solid light body. Crisp with dry finish. Fantastic.
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 Aroma of malts, earthy funk, wood, tart fruits, sour apples. Flavour is sour vinegar, a little malt. Very smooth and tart, wonderfully balanced. Wow.

poured a slight cloudy golden yellow colour with a white head. barnyard, lemons, grapefruits, acid, hay, vinegar, citrus, grains, tart. however for me the 3 fonteinen geuze is a bit better. because of the more sharp sourness.
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2016 white head. Aroma is acetic, lemon. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a light body and high carbonation. Taste is dry t and astringent finish.

Bouteille 37,5cl. 28nov2013. Belle couleur blond doré, mousse furtive presque absente . Nez levuré et boisé. Acidité vineuse et aigre très agréable , qui lui confère une belle longueur en bouche , en sent bien la levure et le chêne , finale sèche et astringente . Carbonation très faible. Simple et élégante...une très belle bière. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Bouteille 37cl @Bioplanet {Bouchon Août 2013}. Belle robe cuivrée sans col ni effervescence. Nez assez doux, suret avec un pointe de boisé, quelques effluves maltées, peu houblonné. La gorgée est assez douce et développe des arômes fruités de raisin, de pomme, courts en bouche mais long en arrières goûts et en saveurs: lorge offre un belle rondeur un pue miéleuse, et le froment tapisse bien tout le palais. Lattaque est acide sur des notes fines. En finale cette acidité reste tenace sur les papilles avec un houblon fleuri très discret qui pique la langue. Belle dégustation qui a de la mâche. Assez succulent !

4 oz draft pour at ChurchKey. Hazy light apricot yellow with little off-white ring. Aromas of vinegar, floral notes, herbs, citrus, stone fruit. Tastes of big tart fruit, citrus, vinegar, citrus peel, light oak. Medium-light body with a dry and tart finish. Very nice.
Champaign orange color with thin white head. Aroma of lemongrass, citrus, orange peel. Bitter with yeast, oak, light citrus, sour, farmhouse, white wine esk finish.

Bottle from Beautiful Beers, consumed at home. Orange-ish gold, effervescent carbonation with minimal head. Scent of grapefruit and lemon, spruce, ginger. Taste is a dry uniform sourness, bordering on acrid. Soothingly tempered aftertaste. Mouthfeel is surprisingly watery, but the carbonation is pleasant. Grows on you.

Cosa dire della regina delle acide? Semplicemente meravigliosa! ambrata sporca con schiuma poco persistente. Al naso un forte profumo di legno bagnato e frutta verde. In bocca corpo medio e decisamente acida come poche nel suo genere. Fruttata ed amara con finale acetico molto gradevole. Birra solo per intenditori consigliata a chi cerca una birra extrema o persone col palato allenato. Crea dipendenza!!

Bottle. Hazy honey gold with cloud like white frothy head. Delicious aromas of lemon blossom, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, oak, some barnyard funk and wet hay. Incredibly complex flavours of sour lemon and lime juice, yeast, a salty/savoury element and oak aged apple cider. Rich, well carbonated mouth feel with immense tartness intertwined. Magnificent beer, which keeps beckoning another sip in a bid to grasp the full flavour profile.

From tap. Sunny gold with smallish whit head. Nose is straight funk. Some gym sock. Oak barrel. Tart apples. Taste is crisp throughout. Bright body of cherries, some apricot. Vague wine qualities. Acidic. Well executed, but no the most interesting of their offering by a mile.

Bottle surprisingly at World of Beer in Tioga. $20 for a 375 ml was a bit much but oh well. Pours clear deep golden color with nearly no head at all into my champagne flute. Aroma of vinegar, apricots, mint leaves, sour fruits. Interesting aroma. Flavor follows closely with a surprisingly juicy fruit flavor, some sour lacto notes but not super acidic at all, sweet fruits like apricots, and very very light oak. The mouthfeel is fuller than most Geuezes I have encountered. Not dry at all like others and the oaky wood presence is extremely subdued here. Low to medium carbonation. While this was a bit different from others of the style, it was excellent with lots of juicy sour fruity flavor. Highly recommended!

Aroma: 3/5
Appearance: 3/5
Taste: 3/5
Palate: 4/5
Overall: 3/5

On tap, in Cantillon brewery. Not my favorite style, but it was good.

How wonderful is this beer. I can immediately understand why people wouldnt like this but this is a favorite. It changes with every sip as well, and under the sourness still retains many fruit flavors.
Tap at In De Wildeman
Wine beer with a old cheese after taste. Acid taste at first. aroma is more cheesy and remains a good white wine. The sourness and the palate are the main difference of this beer.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Amazing!
Orange light bubbles sour grapes and sour apple. No sweetness whatsoever, which is good for this style. Slight earthy leather added to the complexity.
Tap at hops and pie. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aromas of tart citrus, Apple, light spice and funk. Flavor is tart apple, citrus, light spice and funk. Light bodied. Slightly dry end.

Birthday bottle at Churchkey. Hazy yellow-gold with a thin white cap. Aroma is tart and funky with some wet hay, apple skin, and a touch of citrus. Taste is sour apple and grapes, funky earthiness, and sugar and citrus sweetness on the swallow. Light body, thin slightly creamy texture, active carbonation, acidic dry finish. Interesting first foray into the champagne of Brussels.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Molt bona cervesa, el primer glop sobta bastant però després senta molt bé.
Muy buena cerveza, el primer sorbo choca bastante pero después sienta muy bien.
Bottle 37.5 cl from the Internets. Hazy golden with a white head. Gooseberries, elderflower, green apples, grapes, sourness. Very strange aftertaste. Medium body (a bit too heavy), sourbitter finish.

Fresh floral aroma, elder flower, goose berries and faint citrus. Nice clear yellow/orange colour. Taste is nice and sour in the prelude but later when it turns bitter there is strange bitter/sourness combo that doesnt work at all. Medium body, should be lighter. Aroma vice it was very nice so I expected more from the taste but the strange finish lowers the score.

37,cl bottle with cork and cap.
Appearance: hazy orange golden, with a white head(of slightly less then a finger.)
Aroma: Fruity slight tartness and a nice fruityness ( Qumquats zest.)
Taste: Nice sour fruityness (Qumquats) with a bit of funk, less sour as the aroma tells you. A nice balanced Geuze.
medium body, slightly above average carbonation. (Giving a nice sparkling refreshing feeling to it.)

Flasche (75 cl), Abfülldatum: 9 June 2011. - Orangegelb, leicht trüb, feiner weißer Schaum: sieht auf den ersten Blick wie ein normales Bier aus, nichts bereitet den Gaumen auf den Schock vor, der ihn erwartet. - In der Nase scharfe säuerliche Fruchtigkeit, Orangenschale, leichte Muffigkeit. - Im Antrunk für einen kurzen Moment weich und fruchtig, bis die unerbittliche, herbe Säure einsetzt, daß es einen schüttelt. Vorherrschend ist kräftig saure Orangenschale, dazu gesellt sich eine geradezu fiese Herbe und eine dumpfe Bitterkeit ohne Hopfenaromen. Dazu eigenartige Noten wie von Holzleim (Ponal) und Pisse. Dabei mild rezent. Extrem trockener, adstringierender Abgang mit kräftigem Tannin; langer, herber Nachtrunk. - Ein Ausnahmebier. Gueuze ist eigentlich eine Kategorie für sich und nicht mit gewöhnlichen Bieren zu vergleichen.
Holy mother of god. This is one to kill the geuzes of all geuzes. Pale yellow and aroma is all sour up front but not limbic sour. Flavor is beautiful.... Puckering and very dry.

Golden straw colour. The nose is malty and barnyardy and suggests a very tart drink. The flavours are very sour with citrus peel (the white stuff as a homeboy correctly pointed out) tart and even metallic.. Has a drying aftertaste with a surprising refreshing quality.
Labeled 100% Lambic Bio. Pours a clear amber colour with a white head. Aroma is fruity, acidic and sour. Taste is fruity and very sour with lots of acidity. A great example of the style.

Magnum bottle @ Akkurat. My favorite go-to Gueuze that always offer the same consistency. Sour barn and old forgotten cellars where you have forgotten about you hay, lemons and dried, cobweb covered fruits. Perfection in no need of further complexity.

Bottiglia da 33cl. Schiuma fine bianca ed alta un paio di dita, abbastanza persistente, colore giallo scuro opalescente, aroma particolare di vino invecchiato, tipo porto, acetico e profumi di formaggio e mela, al palato corpo medio e buona carbonazione, appare subito una birra molto particolare che si può amare o no, ma complessa e stupefacente: acetica, vinosa, salata il tutto in un equilibrio che ho trovato piacevole e con un finale secco e pulito.Non è una birra da tutti i giorni ma per quando si vuole provare un emozione.

You either love it or you dont. The champagne of Belgium is hard to explain, tastewise. Ive introduced it to girls who cant stand beer, and who doesnt believe me when I tell them this is beer. Knowing how it is made helps, but well, it is, dry, sparkly, vinious and so wonderful sour. Thats all I dare to say.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Slightly hazy orangy golden with small bubbly white head. Nice visible carbonation. Light sweet grains, unripe peach, lemons, lots of barely ripe fruit tart/bitter mix. Light cheese and hay. Slightly acidic. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lovely complex stuff. 

Update: 1996 vintage drank at Quintessence 2016. More sour, rubbery and spicy, lots of pure lemon juice. Very interesting, not really better, but very nice to try this one.

Color dorado pálido limpio con ligera espuma blanca. Aromas de fruta verde, madera y brett. En boca es ligera con un inicio afrutado, dulce y ácido muy equilibrado que contrasta con un final ,muy seco. Muy rica.

How hadnt I rated this before? 0,375l bottle @ St. Urhos. Pours cloudy golden with a low head. Aroma is sour malts with some apples. Flavor is very sour malts with some apples and vinegar. Exquisite.
Very funky! Mushrooms, aged cheese, and barnyard animals in the aroma. Lots of carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Hints of Champagne. Very sour.

Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Tasted a 1 year old (2013) and 12 year old (2002) version.
2013 : light orange. Aroma is tart. Taste sour, dry bitterness, dry finish. : 5/10, 3/5, 6/10, 3/5, 11/20.
2002 : cloudy light orange with a tiny white head. Aroma is a bit sour but not that acerbic. Taste is sour, less bitter than the younger one, little fruity.

Poured from 750 to glass. Straw hue with fizzy white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is acetic, lemon, grapefruit, lactic, straw. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a light body and high carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a tart following and dry astringent finish. Overall this is a nice brew.

Pours translucent amber into a tumbler with frothy head, above average lacing/retention and aroma that takes you right to the brewery. Speaking of which- upon your first time walking into the brewery youre hit with, what you later realize is the house terroir which this beer encompasses and embodies in all its greatness. Execution has been consistent for years, and this takes the nod as the beer that got me into lambic many years ago. One of the most solid, if not the best fresh gueuze available on the market. Aging does this wonders as well. Having sampled examples from the 70s through current, I can say without doubt that this gueuze certainly defies the test of time. This serves as the archetype and benchmark for those who age lambic as a hobby.
One of the better sour Belgians Ive tried, but have not yet joined the supporters club. This will at least not make my face turn into nasty grimaces.

New 2014 Belgian Flag label; bottled 4-Oct-13. Hazy turbid amber, large rocky head quickly dies to a fine lacing. Aromas of musty basement, tart, acidic vinegar, lemons, grapefruit, hint of white wine, hay, cereals, bit of barnyard funk, yeasty, earthy grassy hops. Sharply citric & sour, nice grapefruit bittersweet flavours with a light sweetness from the malt & wheat trying to balance things out, slight milky sourness towards the end. Medium bodied, with lively, prickly carbonation cleansing the tongue leading to a bitter, drying long finish.
Bottle at Tre Små Rum Göteborg. Hazy gold with white head. Sour smell and sour wild taste, nice balancing bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 37.5cl bottle served in a Hoegaarden Grand Cru glass. Pours an orangey light amber colour with a very short lived white head. Despite a constant stream of bubbles emerging a somewhat flat beer. Mouthfeel is quite good for such a (relatively) light beer. Aroma is awful. Would be unfair to say what it smells like but the label provides a humorous likeness. Will not be trying any more beers of this style or from this brewery.
Taster at the source. Pours orange gold with a tight white head. Aroma is wet blanket, mild clove. Flavor is very dry, slight oak, yogurt sour. Very fine carb.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2015 Clear, sunny-yellow color, small head. Sour, funky, yeast, apple. Very well balanced lambic. Not too sour, yeast featheres the sourness while wheat adds a grainy, pleasant complexity. Sunny, tart, refreshing mouthfeel. Apple with a funky, acidic sourness, which stays long on the palate. Carbonation is very lively, adding freshness to the beer.

Cantillon gueuze 14 vintage

Pours a straw-yellow color, with a spongy, stable head, which is half a finger broad.

Exhibits an unbelievable balance between funky tartness, dusty wood and slightly spiced, citraic fruitiness. Reveals a plethora of subtle aromas, adding depth to the nose, a whiff of glue, old yogurt, vinegar and leather - leading to a unique smelling beer, full of little details.

Reveals a refreshing mouthfeel, due to the high carbonation, medium bodied beer.

Doesnt taste particular fruity in a sense of being specifically heavy on apples or very orange-like, while the beer does feature in fact a generous fruit note, with a lemony crispness to it. This impression gets balanced by musty, leathery malts, matured hops and vinegar, establishing a long lasting sourness. There is almost an explosion on the palate, as the carbonation hits the tongue, establishing an intense dryness, which is noteable until the very end. Finishes with a full-scale, crisp dryness, which doesnt numb the palate from receiving more subtle flavors though.

No fruits are needed to make this a great beer. I am astonished by its complexity, based on the beers lower abv. So much going on, while every aspect is artfully integrated in the beers taste, and interacts very well with its overall refreshing character.

Bottle 375 ml, c&c, into a tulip. ABV 5%
Pale orange golden colour on the body, with a small white head, froathy, with low retention, light lacing on the glass.
Fruity aroma with peaches, sour too, some funk.
Taste is sour, with grapes, sour apple juice, light wood, floral notes.
Medium thin body with low carbonation, very tart.
Overall nice gueuze, refreshing.

Bouteille daoût 2013. Orange voilée, effervescence faible, col blanc presque absent. Légèrement vineuse (vin blanc), notes acides de vinaigre, de pommes et de citron, plutôt sèche, légèrement boisée et un peu amère sur la fin. Doit aussi se goûter plus vieille.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with rapidly settling white head. Minimal to no lacing. Aroma is tart, acidic, buttery oak, fruity, apricot and peach, mild vinegar. Flavor is moderately tart up front, building slightly, big oak, buttery oak, dried peach and apricot, mild vinegar, mildly vinous with a lingering oaky, acidic finish. Soft to moderate carbonation, medium-light body, and moderately dry, astringent finish.

2/1/2013 bottle picked up last year and popped on a nice holiday weekends. Dry, earthy funk that you pretty much only get from the real deal. Beautiful in the glass like very few sours are. Not just sour but complex with subtle waves of flavor and funk that never say die ... theres so much happening. This is a treat and hard to rate -- numbers dont really tell the story.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit ordentlicher weißer Schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich, fruchtig. Geschmack holzig, fruchtig, säuerlich.

Pours a transparent orange/yellow with a small white head. Tons of carbonation. Aroma: Lemons, super tart, super fruity. Lots of hay. Palate: Medium bodied, fizzy. Taste: Very tart, but not as tart as it smells. Slight sweetness there.

Review #100- 37.5cl bottle. Appearance is hazy, lots of carbonation, small fizzy white head, yellowy orange in colour. Big aroma, which you can smell from a mile off. Tangy, musty, straw, sweaty (in a good way), citrus zest, fruits, bit of pineapple, grapefruit, gooseberry. Taste- lots of fruity juciness, tangy, a bit tart, sourness, musty, a dry finish, plenty of vinous qualities, coats the mouth well. Impressive.

Bottle @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Slightly cloudy yellow, small white head, nice lacing. Aroma, sour, malty, yeast, light fruity notes, floral, grain. Taste, malty, sour, rhubarb, red berries, lemon, lime, peber, spices. Dry mouth feel. Sour aftertaste, with peber,
Bue en bouteille. Lacidité trop présente ma fait détesté cette bière. Difficile à boire pour moi.

A- Pours a hazy sunset color with a nice, thick pillowy head.

S- Sour, lemon, citrus, funk, orange.

T- Bready and it hits like a train with an intense sourness up front. Lemon and citrus play a big part.

M- Medium bodied with a good deal of carbonation.

D- One of the best sours ive had to date. A great beer that I wouldnt mind having again.

1500 rates bitches. 2010 bottle. And while this was not even in the top 5 of the afternoon from a rankings perspective, this rating is honoring the fact that in a couple of years, how far I have allowed my palate to come. Sticker said $14.51 which I find to be funny.  One of the funkiest beers I have ever had. Four years put this beer into the zap all moisture from mouth and leave a tart stinging lemon lingering aftertaste in my mouth. Not complaining. Barnyarrd funk, tart citric acid.  Good, but I think I detected some oxidation however. I think I am a fresh guy. Super happy to try - thanks Donnie.

Forsyth County Bumble Tasting. Scent is funk and sour grapes. Flavor is sour, slightly sweet, and earth. Pours just hazy pear with rapidly dissipating white head. Light medium body and incredibly carbonated. Classic Gueuze. Classic Tick. Bottle - Shared at Tasting
floral, citrus, pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, astringent,

Bottle. Pours pale, slightly hazy, a bit of foam. Aroma is thick, feels like apple juice, still fermenting. Taste is versatile, starting off with a fruity note, followed by bitterness of an apple that is gone bad - everything in a good way. This bitterness remains in a mouth for a while. Complex beer.

Aroma: citrus, fruity flavours, sours, champagne-like. Appearance: clear pale gold, small white head. Taste: medium sour. Palate: bitters coming up, citrus flavours again, average-long finish, dry. Overall: a Lambic, not my favourite style, nice aroma, but too sour for me overall. Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.
Classic geuze. little head, golden hue. fantastic, smooth even finish. soft on tongue. benchmark for the style.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Bottle, 75cL. Naintré, France. With dad, mom, TC and TZ. A pale yellow brown beer with a medium white head. Poor persistence. When I took the top off the bottle, I discovered beer on the cork. Worrying ?!? No :) Good aroma : wood (intense), cider (apple), smoked, lactic acid. Heavy dry sour sharp notes every sip of beer. Light bitter. Medium to light body, thin texture. Average carbonation. Lasting dry sour finish. Overall, delicious : dry sourness with still fruity character and aroma of oak barrel.

3/21/2014 : 8-3-7-3-16 (bottle, 37.5cL)

Capped and corked small bottle into a tulip glass. Effervescent and champagne-like pour. Smaller head than I was expecting, gone in an instant. Very clear, again not what I was expecting. Aroma of cheese, yogurt, cloves, spring flowers, lemon zest. Carbonation is strong but not overwhelming. Taste is mostly the same as the aroma with a nice hop bitterness in the finish. Overall a very nice interpretation of the style. I would have liked to see a brighter color and somewhat cloudy suggesting live yeast, but still very nicely done, went well with the pork and rice.

average fizzy white head. good lacing. fully diminishing. sparkling average yellow body. aroma: vinegar, white wine, lemon. if: moderate acidic, light bitter, acetic vinegar. ff: light sweet moderate acidic bitter, acetic vinegar, salty; long duration. palate: light medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation, moderate astringent finish. Mais complexa que todas as gueuze que já tomei, mas menos azeda que eu esperava. Amargor de casca de limão. Amargor crescente lembra também algo defumado trazendo a mente a presença de cinzas, ou definitivamente algo queimado, talvez madeira. Bem peculiar. Amargor escalante, bem como a presença de cinzas. Toques salgados de azeitona. Copo mais estreito liberou menos aromas azedos. Bem pro final, no ultimo terço da cerveja e com ela já mais aqwuecida, sente-se leve dulçor, lembrando, de longe, mel. Segundo sibila yabu então, lembra amargor de lima e de água tônica. 200 s

Bottle 0.75l. Pours cloudy golden orange with almost no head. Aroma is sour, apples, white wine, vinegar. Taste is sour, almost no sweetness and bitterness, tart, apples, white wine grapes, dry, crisp. Aftertaste is sour, touch of bitterness, smooth carbonation. Great beer, refreshing and very balanced.

Goudgeel (appelsap)helder bier bijna geen schuim. Aroma van appel(Granny Smit en een zoete appel) cider. Smaak is heerlijk fris zuur, wat fruitigs. Heerlijk bier wordt in de zomer zeker herhaald. Gedronken met Bryan
Bellissimo colore oro antico. Aroma vinoso con tutte le sfumature di acidità lAttica e acetica .Il sapore è di vino e prevale l?acetico. Una punta intensamente amara che perdura

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Un classique FINALEMENT dans MA bouche. Couleur jaune, mousse blanche. Arôme sauvage, grains, un peu dagrumes. Belle acidité en bouche, fraîcheurs, levures. Simples, complexe en même temps. Excellente.

Fles gedeeld met lachneger. Goudgeel helder bier bijna geen schuim. Aroma van appel cider. Smaak is heerlijk fris zuur, wat fruitigs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Classica gueuze di cantillon, sempre la benvenuta! Acidità vinoso-acetica intensa e pervasiva, note morbide di vino bianco e una sfumatura amara molto piacevole. Da Bruxelles con furore, solo il meglio.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2014 Bottle from the brewery. Nose is Chardonnay. Lemon zest, pith, vinegar, cheese, big apples in the nose. Awesome. Flavour is sour, sour, sour, a little salt, more sour apple. Light, medium carbonation. Finish is long and sour. A taste sensation.

Pours cloudy gold. This is very different from most beers so I havent an acquired taste. Aroma is white wine, some cheese. Extremely sour flavours with little or no sweetness. Lasting bitterness. I like it for what it is but its not a style that Id like.
Very unclear golden. Superbly strong sour aroma. Extremely sour taste and aftertaste of sour citrus juice and dry Champagne. Dry mouthfeel.
Tried at the brewery. Acidic with notes of hay and grass, citrus and green apples.
Thanks northropfrye for this one. Aromas of rhubarb, lemon juice, wood. Flavors are sour vinegar, cardboard, woody bitterness. Very nice and intense.

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought direct from brewery. Fantastic sour sharp tasting geuze but with none of the artificial sweetness often associated with the commercial versions. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

37.5 cL bottle at home, the cork had leaked a bit. Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma has barnyard, some citrus, malts, slightly musty, wood and some tartness. Taste is over medium sour with quite some citrus, apple and some barnyard. Taste way more refreshing than you would expect from the aroma. Dry finish. Medium body and carbo. Nice stuff.
Lime, brett, old furniture, funk, and hay in the nose. Very clean taste with good acidity and a salty touch. Tart but clean aftertaste that leans sweet, like Trolli worms.

2012 750ml bottle. Pours a very bright and sparkling light gold. Fine carbonation running up the glass. Aroma is sharp with vinous notes of white wine, vinegar, light lemon and some apple. Taste was very nice with medium tart apple, lemon, more white wine and a light bready body. The carbonation allows the flavors to resonate on the palate, giving the finish a longer feel...although it is very dry and crisp.
Tasted on bottle. 05/02/2014 in Brussels. There are a lot of apple in this geuze. Without carbonation the taste of the fruit is very high. My first gueuze. Next one please.
Little bottle of the 100% Lambic Bio from Frankies Pizza. Awesome beer, really fresh and dry, super crisp tart taste. 10/10, would drink again.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 Bottle conditioned on Feb 2014. Bottled on 7 May 2013. Hazy sparkling gold body. Thin white head with no retention. Nose is sour sweets, lime, foam sweets, lemon, oak, some apple, fruit. Strangely artificial. Very sour. Sour finish. Moderate carbonation. Excellent, but was the £6.95 price tag justified? 7 3 9 4 15### Bottle on Feb 2016. Bottled in 2015. Cloudy gold body. Medium white head. Sour lemon, oak, apple, malt, Cava. Sour. Crisp and refreshing mouthfeel. Dry finish. 7 3 8 4 14
Cloudy amber/yellow with fast disappearing creamy head. Smell of citrus, camaramel and lemon freshness. Strong acid taste with mild dry after-taste. Not really my style bit enjoyable.

Bouteille 750ml, janvier 2013. Couleur orangée trouble, mousse blanche fuyante présentant des bulles imposantes et laissant une belle dentelle, un peu huileuse. Arôme de brett fruité, acidité, pomme verte, étable léger. Goût de pomme, brett qui enveloppe le palais, fruité, malt subtil, acidité moyenne qui fait un retour en force en fin de bouche. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen. Une bière rafraîchissante possédant une buvabilité féroce.
0,375l fles gedeeld net nikos, mooi goudgeel. Aroma van zure appel, azijn  smaak mooi zuur en een erg volle afdronk.

An amazing array of aromas and flavours, my bottle poured quite flat, but still very tasty. One of the great appetiser beers of the world. Brings back happy memories of great bars in Brussels , where I always used to have a lambic gueuze to start .

Se si parla di Lambic si parla di gueuze Cantillon. Inimitabile gusto acido, perfettamente bilanciato in tutto. Scarsa frizzantezza e alta acidità. Ottima.

cheese, rotten eggs, pale, white foam, salty, full body, long finish, flat
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 Very naturally, farmhouse, orange aroma. Hazy golden with white head. Sour taste of grape & citrus. Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation & dry finish.
A: Dark yellow, cloudy. S: Vinegar and tart. T: Starts sour, goes in very deep tart then goes back to sourness with some hints of barnyard and tart. M: So dry. O: Unique classic.

BOTTLE 37,5CL.

Look: golden and cloudy with small white frothy head with poor retention.
Aroma: mild green fruit sourness, fruit seeds/stones, funk.
Taste: follows the aroma. Acidity on the higher side.

Thanks to TeoTap
a ten years old bottle of Cantillon
amazing beer, but you have to understand it
the great difference betwen this and a young one is that the taste is really more mellow and equilibrated
Ill have to wait eight more years to enjoy mine...
Smak och doft av vete, jäst, grönt äpple, grapefrukt, citrus, citron, vinäger med toner av trä och halm. Syrlig, frisk med en aning sträv beska.
Bottle. Clear golden with white head. Aroma is apples, apricots, lemon, citrus, vinegar. Fruity and sour taste. Medium body and dry finish.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of oak, fruit, vinegar and sourness.
Bottle at Vail. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing. Pours a golden color with white head. Funky, cheesy aromas and flavors. Fuck yeah @@ron

(Bottle): Pours a slightly hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of funk, vinegar, apple cider, lemons, orange peel. Flavour is very tarty, loads of vinous notes and stewed apples. Grapes, lemon, wood barrel and white wine dryness accompany. Excellent.

Bottle
Aroma-citrus, peach
Appearance-pale, clear, minimal white foam, 
Taste-lightly bitter, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter-sour finish
Overall-very good

Thanks to awalk1227 for this extra, cheers Austin!
Bottled 2010

A: Gold in a glass with a beautiful two finger loose foamy head which falls to a quilt of the same. Evident carbonation ribbons.

S: horseblanket, tart vinegar, fine presence of lemon zest, lime zest, grapefruit rinds. Man, I cant get enough. Neither can my wife.

T: So tart. So nice. I struggle to articulate the satisfaction I get from this beer. Its outstanding.

M: Medium-light bodied ale with, of course, medium high carbonation. 

D: This beer is absolute in its drinkability. Outstanding.

Serving type: bottle

03-07-2011
Pale straw pour. Dusty hay, grapefruit funk. Grapefruit pith on the taste with a very distinct tartness. Finishes with an acidic cleanliness and a bit of brett.

small white head disappears fast. copper colour. aroma of brett-funk, citrus, sulphur and horse. taste of lactic acid, wood, wry with a long and dry finish. medium body and carbonation. solid.  bottle 75 cl / bd oct-2012

Golden yellow orange pour with fastly dissipating white head. Funk wild yeast smell with grapes. Pretty sour fresh too. Tart taste of white grapes and citrus fruits. Really fresh but not overwhelmingly sour. Thin and dry mouthfeel, like a champagne without the high carbonation. Very good and refreshing Gueuze. Typical Cantillon.

2012 bottle. Pours a golden amber with a defined foam head, nicely carbonated. The aroma is of moderate funk, grape like fruit, barnyard scent of wheat and straw. In the flavor I noticed wheat grains, a fading tart taste, grapes, sugar, and a slight crisp dry finish. Overall a very fine beverage.

Rating from 25.3.2008: Mein Bier ist laut Korken 2002 abgefüllt, hat somit also 6 Jahre gelagert. 
Ich hab diese schon etwas ältere Variante vor ein paar Wochen durch Zufall in St. Vith im Delhaize gefunden - die hatten hinter den neuen Flaschen noch eine etwas älter aussehende Flasche, die noch kein Abfülldatum auf der Rückseite trug - also hab ich sie neben einer 2008er Flasche zum Ausprobieren mal mitgenommen. 
Nach entfernen der schwarzen Alufolie offenbarte sich mir ein total verrosteter Kronkorken. Ich weiß jetzt, warum die Biere noch einen echten Korken tragen - sonst hätte ich das Ganze nämlich wegschütten können. 
Nach entfernen des Kronkorkens musste ich unter fließendem Wasser ersteinmal den ganzen Rost von der Flasche schrubben... 
Der Korken war auch schon sichtlich gealtert und sah schlimmer aus als von nem 25jährigen Wein - immerhin war er nicht auseinandergebröselt... 
Jetzt aber zur Bierbewertung: 
Der deutlich ausgeprägte Geruch ist sehr frisch, lebendig, leicht fruchtig und nicht zu übersäuert. 
Auch bei meiner Variante hält sich der Schaum nicht sonderlich lange. 
Das Bier ist sehr CO²-haltig und beim ersten Schluck bei weitem nicht so sauer wie erwartet. Schon der Nachgeschmack des ersten Schluckes ist überwältigend - ich schmecke ein komplexes Frucht-Holz-Hefearoma, über dem eine leicht herbe Säuerlichkeit schwebt, die aber außer im Antrunk überhaupt nicht dominant auftritt. Schon der Hauptteil ist von einer milden Cremigkeit geprägt, der komplexe und schwierig zu beschreibende Nachgeschmack ist sehr lange anhaltend. 
Die 6 Jahre Lagerung - auch wenn es die unterste Etage eines Supermarktregales war, ist dem Bier doch sichtlich gut bekommen. 
Es ist natürlich vor allem im Antrunk noch immer sehr sauer, aber ich empfinde diese Saure Note als sehr angenehm und auch gut bekömmlich(im Gegensatz zu z.B. dem jungen Cantillon Kriek, was ich vor ein paar Wochen probiert habe). 
Es hat was mild-cremiges und ist dadurch auch sehr süffig. 
--> kann jedem nur empfehlen, seine Geuze auch mal ein paar Jahre (viell. dann besser im Keller) ruhen zu lassen!! Test vom 25.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,13,12,14,13,13 - 12,90
Pours golden with big fizzy carb and head. Aroma is dusty funk and tart, taste is tart acidic with a dry clean finish, great one

Dark light copper in colour with a small fine laced white head. A notch of hazyness to it. Aromas of apple cider, white wine and white raisins arise. Brief lively fizzyness on the tongue offering a water texture offering a rather light to lightmedium developping body. Light-medium sour with some faint bitter dryness to it. The finish is lightsour-bitter and medium lasting.

Gueuze classique, peu de mousse, couleur assez claire, une bonne acidité (mais moins que la 3 Fonteinen par exemple), un très léger boisé, un goût vineux (comme du Chamagne), un peu de pommes et dépices peut-être. Bonne persistance aromatique. Un Classique

The Belgians know how to do sours. This one is delightful. While the primary note, somehow it's not overbearing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A true classic, and a beer I could drink as much as possible of. Very well-balanced sourness, with a lot of gunpowder and a touch of vinegar.

Bottle @ DØE Århus S meeting. Pours clear light yellow with a white head. Aroma of sourness, wet wood, barnyard, apples, green grapes, dusty. Flavor is sourness and rather sour, wood, dusty, barnyard, grapes, green apples, little vinegar. Thin body, soft carboantion, acidic finish. 201113
Dunkel strågul farve med lyst skum. Syrlig lukt av frukt. Smak av syrlig frukt. Vinøs. Melkebaren.
Dunkel gulbrun farge. Syrlig duft. Tynt dekkende skum. Frisk syrlig litt salt smak. Mye smak.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Bu en bouteille de 37.5cl, javoue que je ne serais pas objectif puisque cest ma première gueuze et que ça ma rendu dingue à ma première dégustation. 
Couleur ambrée limite couleur miel de sapin, une petite mousse qui tombe vite avec des bulles qui monte perpetuellement. Une bière agréable en nes on ressent les notes acides de la pomme et du citron voire du coing. En bouche lacidité explose à la première gorgée, cest impressionnant surtout quand on sy attend pas, on est presque à tirer une gueule incroyable, mais cest que se cache lintérêt de cette bière.
Le côté vineux ressort derrière, une ponte citronnée en plus, assez proche du Chardonnay voire du Savagnin Houillé, on ressent encore le citron la pomme verte. Cest long en bouche et cest succulent.
Frisk og let bitter Gueuza. Jeg tænker den kunne være god til stærk fiskeret. Kan sagtens bruges :-)
Yellow orange no carbonation or head. Glass Cantillon brewary after tour. Sting of fruit before ripeness citrus apricot vinegar. Intersting
Blond amber colour, white foam. Very well balanced geuze. Easy drinkable. Aroma of green apple, lemon and vinegar. Tart aroma. Dry aftertaste.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 Pours slightly hazy blond, finger white head.

Smell funky, tart and wheaty, bit of bile.

Taste oaky bandaid, lots of tart Cantillon funk, both brett and lacto present.

Light bodied, refreshing

Very good

2006 at the brewery

Pours hazy light gold, finger white head.

Smell oaky barnyard citrus

Taste strong tart, lemon, citrus, funky and complex oak

Light

Very god.

Spuyten Duyvil, Brooklyn 375ml bottle (expensive): Managed to get a little glass of this. Pours is brownish yellow with white head. Aroma is basement, tartness, vinegar. Taste is similar. Plenty sour. Plenty tart. All sorts of weird cheesy, basement flavors. Wonderful to get a taste of this for sure.

2010 Version.

A: Deep Orange/Mild Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, No Lacing

S: Hay, Lemongrass, Mildly Vinegary

T: Semi Acidic (some citrus/some vingar), Lemony

M: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium, Mildly Acidic

Overall, this is similar to the classic gueze except without the in your face acidity, scaled back on the taste mildly.
Väldigt druvig och fruktig, konstig eller? ;) väldigt bra balans för en spontanare.
2010 bottle. Pour is lightly golden and hazy. Aroma is a lot of funk, nice and sour. Flavor is strong tartness, with mild sweetness. Really nice overall.

Pour thanks to beechner224. 2010 bottle.  Pours a fairly hazy light golden orange color. Big funky sour aroma. Light sweet flavor up front followed by big tart sour gueze flavor. Nice funky flavor in this one.... Great example of style.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2013 Golden, hazy, small white foam; earthy, vinegar, grapes, floral? aroma; medium(+) sourness then lightly bitter; refreshing, tart, light body, thin feel, very slightly metallic, long sour, tartish finish
Overall: very high drinkability, refreshing, perfectly balanced taste, GRAND
Bottle from brewery. Complex aroma. Cloudy gold. Champagne-like carbonation which dissipates rather quickly. Refreshing tartness. Cheese, herbs, slight vinegar, apple.
Det här var en riktigt trevlig öl med en fin, komplex och syrlig smak. Kroppen var okej och balansen fanns på plats. Slutsats; den här kan jag med lätthet dricka mer av.

Purchased from Hunger Mountain for exactly $17.00. Pat said it was among one of the last bottles they had. After I told him that it sounded like a great deal, he personally fetched it for me from the back. Thanks, man. To bulbous tulip, poured an mellow apricot yellow-orange with a trim, almost nonexistent snowy head barely a fingernail in length. Eventually, it vanished to mere pops of small bubbles. Smells and tastes of pineapple, sweat, avocado honey, bay leaf, wheat grain, white wine lees, spearmint, and sherry vinegar, but brief. Couldnt have gone made it through college without this classic.

750-ml bottle, 2012. Classic Sour nose of lactic acid and light citrus. Pours a deep medium orange without much head. Bristly tart flavor with a balancing sweetness; slight herbal tone and a bitter, sour-lemon finish. Medium body, prickly texture. Still the standard for Gueuze.

Clear yellow orange beer which makes little white head which doesnt last long. Yeast particles can be seen in the glass. The aroma is sour vinegar and white wine with little sour apple as well. Flavor is also mostly just vinegar and little maltiness. The vinegar makes a throat-burning long finish. Medium full palate with low carbonation. Im kinda puzzled, this was my first gueuze lambic, not sure if I want to try more.
Bottled dec 2012. Flute glas. Sur og frisk lige som lambic skal være. Hærlig guldgul farve med lige skum som forsvinder. Sur eftersmag. God!

0,375l bottle from England. Hazy, yellow colored beer with small, white head. Tart, fruity odor. Dry, tart, fruity, lively aroma. In the end its fruity. It has a little cellar feeling. Deliciously sour taste, its bitter-sour feeling is a bit like tonic water. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Dry, yeasty, tart finish. Very delicious Lambic, lively but delicious tart flavours. Balanced but impressive. Its aroma is much livelier and stronger, than the 3 year matured Cantillon Grand Cru.

2012 bottle to glass. hazy gold pour with a thin white head. Nose is tart earthy hay with a beautiful sweet floral backbone. taste is sweet tart bitter hay with a long semi dry finish. Nice floral backbone similar to the nose. Low carbonation. Smooth body.

[2012] 375ml bottle at Bistro LAutre Oeil. Pours clear golden with a shy white head. Subtle barnyard, funky, dusty, earthy and lemony aroma. Taste is sour, tart, green apples, lemon, grapes, vinegar, old cheese and oak. Thin body with a long dry sour finish.

on tap at brouwers zwanze day 13. Flat orange cloudy pour. Aroma of pungent vinegar, body odor, kombucha lemons. Tastes strongly of vitamins. some grassyness apricots yeast minerals shrimp. Coats the mouth with yeasty residue. Need something like bread to eat alongside to balance it out.

Bottle at Monks Cafe in Philly. Have had several times here on draft, along with multiple other Cantillon varieties, but never the classic in a bottle. Feb 2013 dated bottle. Cantillon seems now way overhyped, but a fresh taste of the classic blend quickly makes you realize its not hype at all. Full and balanced. Perfectly blended sour. Deep amber fruit flavors. Palate is extraordinary. This is definitely the Gueze standard.

So glad to finally open this one. 2011 bottle split over a horror movie. Aroma is starfruit, kiwi skin, lemon peel, and rubber funk. Pours hazy blond with a nice looking swirling film. Taste is great with some tart citrus, startfruit, mineral, slight bandaid funk and a lemon peel as it warms. Complex and wonderful without being intense.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Bottle: 2011... thanks, Mike! Perfect copper color with great clarity as it settles; the foamy white head escapes quickly and leaves a few small lacing rings at the top of the glass. Aroma is ripe, green apple skins, lemon acidity, sour white grapes, vinous oak notes, funky barnyard floor, sweaty horse funk, piles of wet hay & wood, and even what Id call sweaty feet. Mild cheesy notes, too. Sounds strange, but its fantastic. So tart & funky. Taste is the same with with sharp acidity up front, tart like a gueuze should be. Lemon, wet oak barrel notes, barnyard, stone fruits, horseblanket, damp cellar floor, vinous white grapes, mild white wine vinegar, and some more cheesy & sweaty feet. Ripping dry finish. One of the finest original gueuze around.

Bottle at Monks Cafe, dated February 2013 (8 months old).
Appearance: Hazy straw to amber body with a short white head that quickly disappears.
Aroma: Wow, barnyard, lemon, earthy straw, very complex. Light sweetness with tart.
Taste: Light tart on the intro, very mild, mellows moreso into lemon peel finish with straw and leather complementing it.
Palate: Light-Medium bodied with high carbonation.
Overall: Nice! Balanced but has good flavor. Enjoyable, mild, I was expecting more tartness.

Sample from a 750ml bottle, the last pour. 2012 vintage. Totally hazy orange yellow color. Good thin off-white head. Great lemon, apricot tart fruit flavors, light funk. Lighter body. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation, kind of sticky in the finish. Very light pepper. Moderate to bigger tart taste, light sweet. Delicious complex, very well balanced geuze.

Appearance: Hazy pale golden color with a small white fine head.Aroma: Acidic apple.Palate: Medium body. Acidic and a bit dry. Average carbonation.Taste: Apple, acidic and a fine sourness.Overall impression: Refreshing and tasty stuff.Personal stats: Bottle Dr Jekyll in Oslo, Norway.

Bottle: 2013. Nose is beautiful, fresh green apples, wheat, horse blanket, slight peach. Appearance is golden. Taste is vinous and deeply sour, green apples, leading to almost resin and blue cheese taste. Finish is tart and dry. Mouthfeel is slick and lively. 

A beautiful example.
750ml bottle pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Spicy orange aroma. Taste is the same with a tart lemon.
Glowing cloudy peach. Smells of funk and just past peak fruit. Perfectly layered fruity tartness. Opens up dry acidic sour tart fermented peach flavor. Amazing
No vihdoin saan eteeni Cantillonia! Aika huomattavastikin happamampi kuin aiemmin maistamani Gueuzet. Silti olisin tämän hehkutuksen jälkeen odottanut ehkä enemmän.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2014 2011 vintage, 37,5cl bottle. Style defining old vinegar & socks in the aroma, joined in palate and taste by wonderful grapefruit rind and wheat fruitiness (green apple). Dry yet piercing, this geuze is one to revisit in its many evolving guises. / Rerate 2014. aug2013 vintage with Belgian tricolore vintage: sharp astringency, old lemon, pickled cocktail onions, must and old vinegar. Wonderfully expressive aroma filling the room upon uncorking.

Geruch nach Pfirsich und Pferdecke / Brett. Astringierend, gute Bittere - aber trotzdem erstaunlich rund.

Schöne Gueuze - bleibt mein Favorit.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Color: pours blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: lambic, natural barrel, herbal nose. Taste: strong lambic taste with high sour taste. Aftertaste: wet sour taste.

Appearance: Hazy light amber with a finger thick white head.
Aroma: Leather, barnyard and cooking apples.
Taste: Low sweetness and bitterness, and high sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, medium body, low carbonation, very astringent with lingering tart finish.
Comments: Enjoyable and refreshing. 2011 bottle.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - gold pour with a small head. Farmhouse/orchard fruity notes, wood/oak, apple vinegar, yeasty, fruity sour finish. Nice.

37cl bottle. Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy sour and soup, sweet. Flavor is citrus, moderate to heavy sour, also bitter in the end with a average duration. Very weird kind of beer but the more you drink the more you like it.

On draught for Zwanze Day 2013 at Avenue Pub! Pours a hazy straw yellow with light ring of bubbly head. Aroma of nice sour fruits, crisp sweetness, and slight bready grain. Taste follows, light and refreshing, very nicely blended. Another home run from Cantillon.
From the bottle at the brewery. Clear gold color with a firm white head. Tart aroma but also some sweetness or perfume. Tart flavor with a bite in the finish. Pleasant.

Pours golden with lazy head. Aroma is yeasty, spicy fruity. Sour, citrus taste. Short, alchol finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Bottle, fresh with just half a year in the bottle. Pours light hazy orange, with a big creamy head. Aroma has a tart funkiness with farmyard and balanced bretty notes of wood, hay and light spicy perfume. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour and funky, with farmyard and bretty notes. Very balanced and refreshing. Brilliant!


[Old rating: On tap @ Henrik, Bergen.] Pours yellow with a small and quite airy head. Aroma has a sour oakiness, vinegar, brett and fruity notes of orange peel. Medium to full body with very little carbonation. Flavour is sour with brett, vinegar and farmhouse, as well as oak and apples giving a quite sour fruity finish. (7374 15)

Appearance: clear gold color, poured with a tiny hea

Aroma: spicy, sulfur, liquorice, rotten, kind of like farm animals , interesting 

Taste: sour, tart, a bit of farm animal in it but I like it

Palate: lively c02, leaves mouth dry, very minimal aftertaste

Overall: Ive never smelled anything like this before, the taste is good for a sour with a very strong wild side, poured from a bottle, very very rare to get a bottle, also tried it off draft, similar in all categories except the aroma of the draft is totally different, not nearly as wild, this ratings is for bottle

Amazing. Tastes like sour grapefruit and orange. Lots of bretta, some perfume. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Nice sour finish, but not overdone. Soft carbonation. Some chewy ryebread kind of sense here as well. On draft at Volo for Zwanze Day.

Draft at LWW Zwanze Day event in Chicago. Pours a foggy yellow with moderate head. Funky nose and initial taste...nicely sour. Good end to my Zwanze day...tasty.

---Rated via iPhone

Draft at zwanze. Pours murky straw golden. No head. Aroma of funk, barnyard, feet and cheese. Lemon, citrus funk. Taste: tart, earth, diaper. A little sweetness, lasting funky finish. Some mineral at the end. Palate: soft carb, medium body, slick texture. Overall: cantillon. But my least favorite so far. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2014 On tap before Zwanze day. Pours amber with a lacy head. Aroma of sour and funk, a little pale and caramel malts, and light spices. Flavor the same with a nice sourness. Average texture. A good beer.
EDIT: 750ml bottle in a teku.  Hazy amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of light funk, some sourness/tartness, some light malts, and hints of spices.  Flavor a great blend of everything.  A really good beer.

Zwanze day at Stone. Golden yellow with almost no head. Aroma of citrus, hay and barnyard funk. Tart lemon taste with lactic acid and oaky vinegar flavors thrown in. Finishes pretty dry. Great balance even with the slightly harsh finish.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of green grapes, apple, grass, bretta, light earth and basement. Taste is big grape sour with light astringent finish. Crisp, light body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dry sour spontaneous fermenting wonderful spritzy,aroma grain with sour notes pours lightly carbonated,lemony tones match perfectly with dry sour taste
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange. Aroma is citric, barnyad and fruity . Medium sour and light sweet. Not very tart. Medium body and quite fizzy.
Bottle. Pours orange-gold colour with small fizzy white head. Fruity (citrics and apple) and sour aroma. Also fruity taste, acidic and sour. Dry finish.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 The most ordinary beer from Cantillon, but still very good. Has all the aspects of a great gueuze, very sour, with a smooth edge.

Bottled feb/2013. Pours a pale, slightly hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma is sour, funky, with lemon and apple cider with some cured meat in there too. Light body. Fresh, crisp, the sourness is fairly subtle, after the first mouthful at least. A lot of apple cider in the taste for me, with grapes, quite juicy actually. Dry and very moreish to finish. So drinkable. Very tasty.

Lemon puckering from the start to finish. Very well balanced though. Has nice malt and barnyard flavors while being able to see the oaky flavor mentioned on the bottle! No hops but not worried. Awesome from start to finish!
Clear gold with foamy white head. Aroma of white wine, wheat, citrus. Taste of sour and funk. Light and delicious

Bottle from Alko. Ive also had this at the brewery making no notes. Hazy golen beer with dissapearing white head. Sour vinegar aroma has some apple notes. Dry flavour is also sour and has vinegar. Crisp mouthfeel and medium bodied. Very nice!

Fra fat på Cantillon-bryggeriet etter rundtur uten guide: dette blir vel så autentisk som overhode mulig. Stor smaksrikdom og en balanse som gjør at den er særdeles lett å drikke. En unik opplevelse som jeg gjerne gjør igjen, og nå vet jeg hvordan man finner lettest mulig fram til plassen. Et museum som samtidig er et levende bryggeri og med håndverkstradisjoner man neppe finner mange andre steder. Familie og venner satt og rensket ferske aprikoser til neste bryggedag.

Fantastic sour citrus almost candy fruit aroma. Complex aroma off the bat. Darker color than I expected. Its a cloudy darker golden with a lightly white bubbly head that actually stuck around longer than I thought it would, Dry on the front half of the tongue then a slightly delayed zing that encompasses the rest of the tongue. Then it all vanishes- wow. This beer is beautifully complex and balanced.

Lemon and finger nail polish remover. Strong on the after taste sour. No head. Drank at yazoo funk fest

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
O. Draft at Pizza Paradiso in DuPont Circle DC. Pours a murky gold with a white head. Barnyard nose. Tart apple. Smooth and delicious.

This is one of those beers that is a prime reason everybody should visit Brussels at least once. Ridiculously cheap if bought three or six at a time you are rewarded with a world classic lambic that could double as a daily drinker if you had the ability to get more regularly. 

Aroma / Appearance - The golden base had a cloudy tint due to some agitation of the bottle. Streams of fresh carbonation rise up like a nice champagne. A ring of white head adds to the beauty. The scent of spicy oranges and gym socks are present. Fresh the vinegar has yet to really sink in and as a result this is not completely sour.

Flavor / Palate - Vinegar and blue cheese fill the mouth with a crisp texture. Lemons and then a bubbly finish highlight a beer with plenty of complexity but not one that tries to be over the top. Like an excellent champagne it relies on subtlety to achieve its ends. I wish I had more room in my luggage to bring home more.
